title: 天使をイカせてアイテムゲット!!絶頂ガチャでダンジョン攻略！
author: ほーち（平尾正和）
description:
旧題『天使をイカせてアイテムゲット！絶頂ガチャでダンジョンを駆け抜けろ!!』

香西遥真（こうざいはるま）はある日、なにもない部屋で目覚めた。
貫頭衣だけを着せられた十数名の男女とともに。
ほどなく案内役の男が現れたが、なぜ、どうやってそこに連れてこられたのかは、彼にもわからないとのことだった。

そこから案内された先にはダンジョンを中心とした街があった。
ここへ来たものは『探索者』となってダンジョンを攻略するか、『支援者』となって『探索者』を支援する義務があるという。
また、最初にスキルが与えられ、それがその後の活動に大きな影響を与えるのだが、遥真が手に入れたのは〈召喚天使〉と…いうスキルだった。
そのスキルを使ってみると、セラと名乗る天使が会われた。
セラは対価を支払えばアイテムをランダムに召喚できるという。

――セラのこと、気持ちよくしてぇ……？

その天使が求めた対価は快楽だった。
しかもセックスによって与えた快感の度合いで召喚されるアイテムのレアリティが変わるという。

――つまり、天使をイカせてガチャを回すってことか！？……なんという夢のシステム。

準備期間の間、ひたすらセラとセックスをしまくった遥真は、レアアイテムやそれらで強化された能力を駆使してダンジョンの探索を始める。

ソロで探索を進めていく遥真は、やがていろいろな女性と出会い、関係を持つようになる。
そしてそれら女性探索者とのセックスもまた、アイテム召喚のレアリティに反映されることが判明し、遥真はハーレムを築いていった。

天使と、そして女性探索者とのハーレムライフを謳歌しつつダンジョン探索を進めていた遥真は、ある日、新たにこの場所へ送られた幼馴染みと再会する。
彼女はここへ来る前の遥真の状態を知っていた。
それを聞いた遥真はなぜ自分がここへ送り込まれたのか、そしてこのダンジョンは何のためにあるのか、という謎に迫ることになるのだった。>>続きを読む

title_translation.en: Make an Angel Cum and Get Some Items!! Clear the Dungeon with the Climax Gacha!

description_translation.en:
Former title: "Make an Angel Come and Get Some Items! Run Through the Dungeon with the Climax Gacha!!"

Haruma Kozai woke up one day in a bare room. He was with a dozen or so men and women who were only wearing underwear. Soon an usher appeared, but he didn't know why or how they were brought there.

The place they were taken to was a city centered around a dungeon. Those who come here become "explorers" and have a duty to either conquer the dungeon or become "supporters" and support the "explorers." In addition, they are given skills at first, which have a significant impact on their subsequent activities. However, the skill Haruma acquired was "Summon Angel," which allowed him to summon an angel named Cera by paying a fee.

"Make me feel good...?" the angel requested.

The price the angel demanded was pleasure. Moreover, the rarity of the summoned items would change depending on the degree of pleasure given by having sex.

-In other words, you make the angel come and spin the gacha! What a dream system!

During the preparatory period, Haruma had sex with Cera repeatedly and began exploring the dungeon with rare items and enhanced abilities. Haruma advanced his exploration on his own, and eventually met various women and started having relationships with them. The degree of satisfaction from having sex with these female explorers also affected the rarity of the items summoned by Haruma, and he built a harem.

Haruma, who enjoyed his harem life with the angels and female explorers while advancing his dungeon exploration, reunited with his childhood friend, who had been sent to this place anew. She knew the state of Haruma before coming here. Upon hearing this, Haruma began to investigate the mystery of why he was sent here and what the dungeon was for. >>Read more

sub_chapters.name: なにもない部屋
sub_chapters.contents:
気がつけば、俺はなにもない部屋にいた。

窓もなけりゃ扉もない。

家具調度品もない、小学校の教室くらいの白い部屋。

そこに、俺を含めて数名の男女がいた。

「おいおい、なんだよここは？」

「なんであたしがこんなところに……？」

「あれ……？あれ……？」

それぞれが困惑し、一部の人たちは何か呟いていた。

性別も年齢もバラバラだな。

見知った顔は……ない。

「そもそもなんなのよ、この恰好……！」

この場にいる全員が、袖のない、膝丈ほどの白い服を着せられていた。

ボタンもファスナーもない、頭からすっぽりと被る服――貫頭衣っていうんだったっけか――で、少なくとも俺はそれ以外に下着もなにも身につけていない。

「いったいなにが……くそっ！思い出せない……」

すぐ近くから、困惑したような男性の声が聞こえる。

たしかに、いままでなにをやっていて、どういう状況でここへ来たのかが思い出せなかった。

いや、記憶喪失ってわけじゃないんだ。

香西遥真、33歳。

とある片田舎に生まれた俺は、地元の高校を卒業したあと、都会の三流大学を経てどこにでもあるＩＴ企業に就職。

30歳手前でフリーランスになり、それなりにスキルがあるおかげで、収入もそこそこ安定していた。

兄弟はなし。

親戚とのつながりも薄い。

母は数年前に他界。

その直後に体調を崩した父の世話をするため、実家に戻った。

幸い地元にもフリーランスの働き口があったので、父の面倒をみながら生活するのは問題なかった。

しかしほどなく父も死亡。

その時点で田舎ののんびりした暮らしが気に入っていたので、そのまま実家で暮らしていた。

……うん、思い出せるな。

それから……そうだ、町内会の会合に出たような……。

父が死んだあとに、輪番制の順番がうちに回ってきたので、俺が自治会長になった。

正直面倒くさいな、と思いながら、何度目かの町会に出たところまではなんとなく思い出せたけど……そのあとの記憶が曖昧だ。

「なんなのよ、もう……！」

苛立つような女性の声が聞こえ、そちらに目を向けた。

俺と同年代に見える茶髪ロングの女性。

髪にちょっとクセが付いてるから、普段はまとめてるのだろうか？

ゆったりとした貫頭衣を押し上げる胸の膨らみが目に入る。

彼女も、下着を身につけてないのかな？

そんなことを考えたら、股間のほうが大きく――、

「てめぇなにおっ立ててやがんだ？あぁ！？」

ドスのきいた女性の声に、心臓が跳ねる。

「そ、そんなこと言ったって、しかたがないじゃないかぁ……！」

「んだとこのハゲ親父！ぶっとばすよ！？」

元ヤンっぽいお姉さんが、薄毛でメタボなおっさんと揉め始めた。

よかった……俺じゃなかった……。

「だからジロジロ見んなっつってんだろーがぁっ！！」

「ぶひぃーっ！」

元ヤンのお姉さんが、おっさんに前蹴りを食らわせる。

その瞬間、俺は見てしまった。

脚を上げたお姉さんの、貫頭衣の内側を。

根本が黒いボサボサの金髪頭なお姉さんのあそこは、ふわふわと柔らかそうな黒い陰毛に包まれていた。

そしてその陰から、ピタリと閉じた割れ目も、くっきりと見えた。

蹴られたおっさんも、ちゃっかり見てた。

俺の斜め前にいる青年も見ていた。

それのすぐそばにいる少年も、真っ赤な顔を背けているから、やっぱり見ていたんだろう。

「あっ！？」

また別の女性が大きな声を上げた。

艶のある黒い髪をショートボブにした、小柄な女性は、立ち上がったまま自分の身体を見下ろし、なんだか小刻みに震えていたが、不意に歩き始めた。

「あぁ……あぁっ！そんな……！！」

なにやら声を上げながらぐるぐるとそのあたりを歩いた彼女は、ほどなくしゃがみ込んだ。

「あああぁぁ……うああああああーん！」

そしてそのまま声を上げて泣き始めた。

「ちょ、ちょっとアンタ！いったいどうしたの！？」

元ヤンのおねえさんが慌てて黒髪の女性に駆け寄る。

「だいじょうぶ？なにかあったの？」

言いながら、元ヤンさんは黒髪さんをふわりと抱き寄せた。

「なにかいやなことでもあった？ヒドいことされたの？」

「うううー……！うううああ……！！」

そんな問いかけに、黒髪さんは声にならない声を上げたあと、元ヤンさんに抱きついた。

「まいったね、こりゃ……」

元ヤンさんは困ったように呟きながらも、胸に抱いた黒髪さんをなだめるように、背中を優しくトントンと叩いてあげていた。

うん、尊い。

――ガチャリ。

不意に、ドアの開くような音がする。

そちらに目を向けると、さっきまでなかったはずのドアがいつのまにか現れ、その向こうからひとりの男性が現れた。

「みなさんこんにちは、はじめまして」

三十歳前後に見えるその男性は、リクルートスーツ着ていながら、腰に剣を佩くという変な恰好をしていた。

ゲームかなにかのコスプレかな？

よく見るとジャケットの下には鎖帷子を着込んでいるみたいだ。

「おや、さっそくトラブルですか――」

「ちょっと君！」

男性の言葉を遮る様に、さっきまで静かにしていた中年男性が声を上げる。

「これはいったいどういうことかね？」

「あー、なかなか難しい質問ですねぇ」

中年男性の声には深みと重みが感じられ、それなりに社会的地位の高そうな雰囲気を持っていたが、鎖帷子の男は臆することなく飄々と答えた。

「では質問を変えよう。我々をここへ連れてきたのは君かね？」

おお、こんな状況でそんな冷静な質問ができるなんてすごいな。

このおっさん、それなりの修羅場をくぐっているに違いない。

「いいえ、俺じゃないです。っつーか、俺も何年か前にみなさんと同じように連れてこられたクチなんで」

「なに？」

ということは、ここにきたら何年も帰れないってことか？

「……では、なぜ我々がここに？」

「なぜってのが連れてこられた理由っていう意味なら、俺にもわからないです。まぁそれこそ、運とかそんなんじゃないですかね」

俺たちは無作為に選ばれたってことか？

うーん、ここへ来る直前になにをしていたかを思い出せればなぁ……。

「ここは、どこだ？」

「ダンジョンですね」

「ダンジョンっ！？」

突然、俺のそばにいた少年が、突然声を上げる。

中学生くらいかな。

ひょろっとした感じの子だ。

全員の視線が彼に向くが、少年は気にした様子もなく、あるいはそれに気づいていないのか、目をキラキラさせて鎖帷子の男を見ていた。

「ま、ここじゃアレなんで、詳しい説明はこの先でやりますから、ついてきてください」

男の言葉に、全員がザワつく。

しかし男と問答をしていた中年男性が片手を上げるなり、不思議と全員が黙った。

なんというかこのおじさま、後ろ姿からも貫禄を感じられるんだよな。

この人がいなければ、たぶんこの場はもう少し荒れたに違いない。

鎖帷子の男も、なんだかホッとしている様子だ。

「言っては悪いが、このわけのわからん状況で、君についていく必要性はあるかね？」

おじさまがそう言うと、男は開いたままのドアの向こうへ行った。

ガチャリ、と音を立ててドアが閉まると、そこにはなにもなくなった。

「な――！？」

――ガチャリ。

おじさまを始め、全員が声を上げようとしたところで、男が戻ってきた。

なにもなかった壁に、再びドアが現れている。

「このとおり、このドアは一方通行なんですよ」

おじさまが何かを言う前に、男はそう言った。

「ここに残りたければどうぞ。ただ、次にここへ人がくるのは、明日か、明後日か、３日後か、１週間後か……。まぁ10日空くことはないと思いますけど」

「食事や飲み物は？」

「見ての通りなにもない部屋です。向こうから誰かがなにかを持ってこない限り、なにもないままです」

「ふむ……ではせめてここにいる人たちで話し合いを――」

「おれ、行きますっ！！」

おじさまの言葉を遮るように、少年が叫ぶ。

「そっちにはダンジョンがあるんすよね！？」

「ああ、そうだよ」

少年の質問に、男は穏やかな口調で答えた。

「ダンジョンって運営っすか？攻略っすか？」

「攻略、かな」

「攻略かー……まぁいいや！おれ、行きまーす」

タッタッタッとと軽やかに駆け出す少年。

「待ちなさい」

そんな少年を窘めるおじさま。

だが少年は、おじさまを睨みつけた。

「つーか、なんであんたがさっきから仕切ってんすか？他人同士になにしようがおれの勝手だろ」

「だが、この男が信用できるかどうかは――」

「あー、俺もいきます」

おじさまがさらに少年を諭そうとしたので、邪魔をした。

俺が。

「その人に限らずこの場にいる全員が信用できないわけだし、だったら事情を知ってそうな人に俺はついていきますよ」

「む……」

「それに、ダンジョンと聞いちゃあ無視できないよな？」

少年に笑いかけてやると、彼は照れくさそうに顔を背けた。

ま、俺もガキの頃からゲーム、マンガ、アニメ、ラノベと付き合ってきた人生だ。

少年の気持ちもなんとなくわかる。

「私もいくわ」

続けて茶髪ロングのお姉さんがこちらにきた。

「他の人は、来ないってことですかね？」

おじさまは険しい表情で男を見ている。

俺の少し前にいた青年は、戸惑ったようにおじさまと男を交互に見ていた。

ハゲのおっさんは脂汗を垂らしながら、チラチラと様子を窺っている。

たまに元ヤンさんたちへ、ねっとりとした視線が向くのが、ちょっとキモい。

元ヤンさんは困ったように様子を窺っている。

黒髪さんはあいかわらず元ヤンさんの胸に顔をうずめて、泣き続けていた。

尊い。

あとは、最初から声をあげずにずっと怯えた様子のおばあちゃんと、あぐらをかいて腕を組んだまま目を閉じてうつむくガタイのいい兄ちゃんがいた。

「じゃ、しょうがないんで明日また来ます」

男がそう言うと、残った人たちは安堵したように息をついた。

ガタイのいい兄ちゃんは寝てるのかと思ったけど、軽く顔を上げて男を見たあと、すぐにうつむいた。

「ただし、さっきも言いましたがここにはなにもありません。水と食料はもちろん、トイレも、布団も、個室も、仕切りも――」

「アタシたちも、やっぱりいくよ！ほら、立って」

「は、はい……わたしも、いきます……」

男の言葉でなにかに気づいたのか、元ヤンさんが黒髪さんを立たせてこちらに来た。

それに続いておばあちゃんも。

――チッ……。

そのとき、微かにだが舌打ちが聞こえてきた。

その主がだれかはわからないが、よからぬことでも考えていたのかな。

「ふぅ……。どうやらここは君についていかざるをえないようだ」

おじさまもついに折れ、最終的に全員が部屋を出た。

translation.en:
Before I knew it, I was in a room with nothing in it.

There were no windows or doors.

There was no furniture or anything else, just a white room about the size of a primary school classroom.

There were several people in the room, including myself.

"Hey, hey, what's this place?"

"Why am I here...?"

"Huh...? What...?"

Everyone was confused, and some were even muttering to themselves.

Their genders and ages varied greatly.

There was no one I recognized.

"First of all, what's with these outfits...?!"

Everyone in the room was dressed in white, knee-length, sleeveless garments.

These clothes had no buttons or zippers and were slipped on over the head - I believe they're called "kanten-e" - and I, for one, wasn't wearing any underwear or anything else beneath them.

"What the hell is... Damn it! I can't remember..."

A confused-sounding male voice came from nearby.

Indeed, I couldn't remember what I had been doing or how I ended up here.

No, it's not amnesia.

My name is Kousai Haruma, 33 years old.

Born in a rural area, I graduated from a local high school and attended a third-rate university in the city before getting a job at a typical IT company.

I became a freelancer in my late 20s, and thanks to my decent skills, my income was reasonably stable.

I have no siblings.

I have little connection with relatives.

My mother passed away a few years ago.

I moved back to my childhood home to take care of my father, who had fallen ill shortly after my mother's death.

Fortunately, there was work for freelancers in my hometown, so it wasn't a problem to live while caring for my father.

However, my father soon passed away as well.

I liked the laid-back rural life, so I continued to live in my childhood home.

...Yes, I can remember that.

Then... I went to a neighborhood association meeting...

After my father's death, it was my turn to become the head of the community association.

Honestly, I thought it was a hassle, but I vaguely remember attending the town meeting for the umpteenth time. The memories after that are hazy.

"What's going on, seriously...!"

An irritated female voice caught my attention.

A long, brown-haired woman who appeared to be around my age.

Her hair was slightly wavy, so perhaps she usually tied it up?

I noticed her ample bosom pushing up her flowing kanten-e.

Was she not wearing underwear, either?

That thought crossed my mind, and my lower body swelled...

"What the hell are you getting hard for, huh?!"

A sharp-voiced female caused my heart to jump.

"Well, it can't be helped, can it...?!"

"Shut up, you bald old man! I'll knock you out!"

A woman who looked like a former delinquent started a quarrel with a balding, pudgy man.

Thank goodness... it wasn't me...

"I told you not to stare!!"

"Squeal!"

The ex-delinquent woman karate-kicked the man.

In that instant, I unintentionally witnessed the inside of her kanten-e as she raised her leg.

The woman with golden hair and a bushy black-haired head had a delicate, black, fluffy mound of pubic hair.

From the shadows, I could clearly see the tightly closed slit.

The man who got kicked was also looking.

The young man in front of me was looking, too.

The boy next to him was turning away with a red face, so he must have been looking as well.

"Huh!?"

Another woman suddenly raised her voice.

A petite woman with glossy, short bobbed black hair was standing up, looking down at her own body and trembling slightly. Unexpectedly, she began to walk.

"Ah... Ahh! No way...!!"

With a raised voice, the petite woman with short, glossy black hair walked around with shaky steps before crouching down soon after.

"Ahhhh... Uwaaaaaaa!"

And just like that, she started to cry out.

"Hey, hey, you! Just what happened?!"

The ex-delinquent older sister hastily rushed over to the black-haired woman.

"Are you okay? Did something happen?"

While asking, the ex-delinquent sister gently embraced the black-haired woman.

"Did something bad happen? Were you treated meanly?"

"Uuuu...! Uuuwaaa...!!"

In response to such a question, the black-haired woman let out a voiceless cry, then clung onto the ex-delinquent sister.

"I've got a problem with this..."

While muttering with a troubled expression, the ex-delinquent sister continued to pat the black-haired woman's back gently as if to comfort her.

Yes, it's precious.

-- Click.

Suddenly, the sound of a door opening could be heard.

When I looked towards the sound, a door that hadn't been there before had appeared, and from the other side, a man emerged.

"Hello, everyone. Nice to meet you."

The man, who appeared to be in his thirties, was oddly dressed in a recruit suit while wearing a sword at his waist.

Was he cosplaying some character from a game or something?

Looking closely, it seemed like he was wearing chainmail under his jacket.

"Oh my, is there already trouble?"

"Hey, you!"

Before the man could say anything else, a middle-aged man who had been sitting quietly until now raised his voice.

"What's going on here?"

"Ah, that's quite a difficult question."

The middle-aged man's voice carried depth and weight, as if he had a respectable social status, yet the man in the chainmail answered nonchalantly.

"Let me change the question, then. Did you bring us here?`

Wow, it's amazing that he could ask such a calm question in this situation.

This old man must have been through his fair share of hardships.

"No, I didn't. Actually, I was brought here just like all of you years ago."

"What?"

Did that mean once you arrived here you couldn't go back for years?

"...Then why are we here?"

"If by 'why' you mean the reason we were brought here, I don't know either. Well, maybe it's something like luck?"

Were we selected at random?

Hmm, I wish I could remember what I was doing just before I arrived here...

"Where is this place?"

"This is a dungeon."

"A dungeon?!"

Suddenly, the young boy by my side shouted out.

He must have been around middle school age.

He was a stick-thin-looking kid.

Everyone's gaze was directed at him, but the boy, without a care or perhaps simply unaware, looked at the man in chainmail with twinkling eyes.

"Now, since it's not ideal to talk here, I'll explain everything in more detail up ahead. Please follow me."

At the man's words, everyone stirred.

However, when the middle-aged man who had been questioning him raised one hand, everyone miraculously fell silent.

In a way, this man had a certain presence even in his retreating figure.

Without him, this place would probably have been more chaotic.

The man in chainmail seemed relieved as well.

"No offense, but considering this incomprehensible situation, do we really have to follow you?"

As the old man asked that question, the man went beyond the open door.

With a click, the door closed, and there was nothing there.

"What...!?"

-- Click.

As everyone, including the old man, tried to raise their voices, the man returned.

A door appeared on the once empty wall again.

"As you can see, this door only goes one way," the man said before the middle-aged man could say anything.

"Stay here if you want. But the next time someone comes, it might be tomorrow, the day after, three days later, or even a week... Well, I don't think it'll be empty for more than ten days."

"What about food and drinks?"

"This room has nothing, as you can see. Unless someone brings something from the other side, it stays that way."

"Hmm... Then at least let's discuss with the people here—"

"I'm going!" The boy shouted, interrupting the middle-aged man's words.

"There's a dungeon on that side, right?"

"Yes, that's right," the man answered the boy's question in a gentle tone.

"Is the dungeon for administration or conquest?"

"Conquest, I guess."

"Conquest, huh... Well, never mind! I'm going!"

The boy eagerly dashed off.

"Wait," said the middle-aged man, scolding the boy.

However, the boy glared back at him.

"Anyway, why have you been taking charge since the beginning? What happens between strangers doesn't affect me.”

"But whether or not we can trust this man—"

“Oh, I'm going too.”

“I,” interrupting the middle-aged man as he was about to lecture the boy further.

"Not just that person, but everyone present here is untrustworthy. If that's the case, I'd rather follow someone who seems to know the situation."

"Hmm..."

"Besides, who can ignore a dungeon?"

Smiling at the boy, he shyly turned his face away.

Well, I've been into games, manga, anime, and light novels since I was a kid.

I sort of understand the boy's feelings.

"I'll go too," said the long, brown-haired woman, joining us.

"Is nobody else coming?" The middle-aged man glared at the man with a stern expression.

The young man nearby was looking bewildered, glancing back and forth between the middle-aged man and the mysterious man.

The bald old man was peeping around nervously, dripping with sweat.

It's a bit creepy how he occasionally shoots lewd glances at the former delinquents.

The former delinquents seemed puzzled as they observed the situation.

The black-haired woman continued sobbing into the chest of one of the former delinquents.

Noble.

The only ones left were the scared old lady who hadn't uttered a sound from the beginning and the burly young man who had crossed his arms and closed his eyes, looking downward.

"Well, I guess I have no choice but to come back tomorrow," said the man, causing the remaining people to breathe a sigh of relief.

I thought the burly young man might have been asleep, but he briefly looked up at the man before lowering his gaze again.

"However, as I mentioned earlier, this place has nothing: no water, no food, no toilets, no futons, no private rooms, no dividers—"

"We're going too! Come on, stand up!"

"Yes... I'll go too..." The former delinquent woman stood up, followed by the black-haired woman, as if they realized something from the man's words.

The old lady joined them as well.

*tch*...

At that moment, I faintly heard someone clicking their tongue.

I couldn't tell whose voice it was, but I wondered if they were thinking about something shady.

"Phew... It seems I have no choice but to follow you," the middle-aged man finally gave in, and everyone eventually left the room.

sub_chapters.name: 1-1  はじまりの部屋
sub_chapters.contents:
鎖帷子男の先導で廊下をしばらく歩いたあと、全員が別々の部屋に通された。

「あんた、大丈夫？」

「はい……ご迷惑をおかけしました」

元ヤンさんは黒髪さんを最後まで心配してたけど、結局ふたりは途中で別れることになった。

というか、全員がばらばらの部屋に案内された。

通された部屋には、事務職っぽい恰好のお姉さんがいた。

そこで俺は、プレゼンテーションソフトみたいなものを使って、ここの説明を受けた。

とてもわかりやすい説明だったけど、わけがわからなかった。

「えーっとここはダンジョンのある世界……、いわゆる異世界転移ってことですかね？」

「ご理解が早くて助かります。ただ、ここは異世界、といっていいほど広大な空間ではありませんけどね。ダンジョンを中心とした町がひとつあるだけですから」

「俺たちはそのダンジョンを攻略しなくてはいけない？」

「義務というわけではありませんが、この閉ざされた世界から出るためにはダンジョンを攻略するしかない、ということです」

「ダンジョンを攻略すれば、ここから出られる……ということは、元の世界に戻れるってことですかね」

「それは攻略してからのお楽しみですね」

「ダンジョン攻略以外の選択肢は？」

「すべての方が戦闘向きというわけではありませんから、普通の仕事をされている方もたくさんいますね。慣れないあいだはこちらで支援いたしますが、いつまでも、というわけにもいきません」

「働かざる者食うべからずってやつですかね」

「まぁ、そのあたりはどんな世界、どんな社会でもかわらないということですね」

彼女も話せる範囲でいろいろと説明してくれ、その内容を頭ではそれなりに理解できた。

でも、心が追いついてこないっていうのかな。

まるで現実感がないというか……。

「はじめはみなさんそんなものですよ。取り乱さないだけ、ハルマさんは凄いです」

「そ、そんなもんですかねぇ」

キャリアウーマン風のきれいなお姉さんに褒められるってのは、悪くないね、うん。

「状況に慣れるまでは、しばらくお部屋でゆっくりしてください」

「……そうさせてもらいます」

「ただし、10日以内にかならず１度はダンジョンに潜ることをお忘れなく」

これはさっき見せてもらったプレゼンソフトにもあったな。

「必要なことはここに書かれてますから、わからないことはまず調べてください。人に聞く前に、まず自分で調べるクセをつけておいたほうがいいですよ」

言いながら、彼女は冊子をひとつ渡してくれた。

『生活と探索の手引き』

表紙にはそう書かれいて、中を見るとさっき説明を受けた内容だけでなく、さらに詳しい情報が記載されていた。

落ち着いたら、一度目を通しておくか。

「ひと月以内に自立できるよう、がんばってくださいね」

「はい。なんとかがんばってみます」

「ふふ。それでは『はじまりの部屋』へどうぞ。部屋に入ったらステータス確認を忘れずに」

「了解です」

立ち上がった俺は、この部屋に入ってきたドアを開ける。

「あなたの探索に幸あらんことを」

事務員さんの声を背に、ドアをくぐる。

普通なら廊下に繋がっているはずのドアの向こうは、６畳ほどの部屋になっていた。

「ここが『はじまりの部屋』か……」

この部屋は、ここに連れてこられた人が最初に与えられる拠点ってことだったな。

間取りは１Ｋ。

入ってすぐに玄関があり、質素なサンダルが置かれていた。

玄関からのびる短い廊下の先に、６畳ほどの部屋がある。

通路の右側にトイレとシャワールーム、左側に小さなキッチンがあった。

食器類や調理器具、調味料、冷蔵庫があり、冷蔵庫の中には常に食料が満杯となる。

部屋のほうはベッドとサイドテーブル、簡素な椅子が１脚あった。

あとクローゼットもあり、そこには下着類とジャージが入っていて、サイズはすべて俺に合わせているとのことだ。

洗濯はランドリーボックスに入れておけば、衣類も寝具もきれいにしてくれるのだとか。

「至れり尽くせりだな」

ただし、この部屋が使えるのは最初の30日間だけ。

それを過ぎるとこの部屋には入れなくなり、中のものは消えてなくなる。

仮にこの部屋の下着とジャージを身につけていると、素っ裸になってしまうってわけだ。

食料や調味料も、もちろん消えてなくなるから、最終日にごっそり持ち出しても無駄。

ひと月後には自立できるように、と彼女は言ったが、つまりはそういうことだ。

「とりあえず、シャワーでも浴びるか」

いろいろとやらなくちゃいけないことはあるが、まずはさっぱりしたい。

浴室に湯船がないことを残念に思いながらも、俺はさっとシャワーを浴びた。

もちろんシャンプーや石けん、バスタオルなんかも備え付けだ。

「ふぅ、すっきりした」

濡れた髪をタオルで拭きながら、俺は冷蔵庫を開けた。

この中身も、住人の好みに合わせて変わるらしい。

とりあえずペットボトルの炭酸水を取り出し、六畳間のほうに入った。

部屋の中にはベッドとテーブル、椅子、それにキャビネットがあるだけだ。

さすがにテレビやオーディオ器具、ＰＣなんかはないらしい。

クローゼットにはジャージの上下が２セット吊り下げられ、Ｔシャツとトランクスが５枚ずつ、靴下が５セット重ねられていた。

とりあえず下着とジャージを着てベッドに腰掛け、ドライヤーで頭を乾かした。

「ぷはぁ……。さて、と」

炭酸水を半分ほど飲んだあと、俺はいよいよあれを確認することにした。

「ステータス！」

あえて口にする必要はないが、最初の記念ってことで。

「おお」

目の前に、それは現れた。

translation.en:
After being led down the hallway by the chainmail-clad man, everyone was taken to separate rooms.

"Are you okay?"

"Yes... I'm sorry for causing trouble."

While the former delinquent was worried about the black-haired girl until the very end, eventually they had to part ways.

In other words, each of us was guided to different rooms.

In the room I was taken to, there was a lady dressed like an office worker.

She explained things to me using some sort of presentation software.

It was an easy-to-understand explanation, but I couldn't really grasp it.

"So this is a world with a dungeon... like an otherworldly transfer, you could say?"

"That helps that you understand quickly. Although it's not as vast a space that you can call an 'otherworld.' There's just one town centered around the dungeon."

"Do we have to conquer the dungeon?"

"It's not an obligation, but to leave this enclosed world, you have no choice but to conquer the dungeon."

"So if we conquer the dungeon, we can leave this place... does that mean we can return to our original world?"

"That'll be a surprise for after you've conquered it."

"Are there any other choices besides conquering the dungeon?"

"Not everyone is suited for combat, so there are many people who have normal jobs instead. You'll be supported here while you're getting used to it, but that can't go on forever."

"So if we don't work, we don't eat, huh?"

"Well, that doesn't change no matter what world or society you're in."

She explained various things within the range she could talk about, and I could understand the content somewhat with my head.

But I guess my heart can't catch up.

I felt a lack of a sense of reality... .

"Everyone is like that at first. It's amazing that you're not freaking out, Haruma-san."

"Well... is that so?"

Being praised by a beautiful career woman isn't a bad thing, yeah.

"Until you get used to the situation, please take it easy in your room for a while."

"...I will do that."

"But don't forget to dive into the dungeon at least once within 10 days."

I saw that on the presentation software she showed me earlier.

"Everything you need is written here, so if you don't understand something, please check it first. It's better to get into the habit of researching on your own before asking others."

As she said that, she handed me a booklet.

"Guide to Life and Exploration"

The cover said so, and inside there was not only the content she explained earlier but also even more detailed information.

I'll go through it once when I've calmed down.

"Please do your best to become independent within a month."

"Yes. I'll try my best somehow."

"Hehe. Now, please go to the 'Room of Beginnings.' Don't forget to check your status after you enter the room."

"Understood."

I stood up and opened the door to the room.

"May fortune favor your exploration."

With the receptionist's voice behind me, I went through the door.

Instead of leading into a hallway like a normal door, the other side opened into a room about six tatami mats large.

"Is this the 'Room of Beginnings'...?"

This room was the base given to those who were brought here for the first time.

The layout was 1K.

There was a simple entryway with sandals just inside.

A short corridor extended from the entryway and led to a six-tatami mat room.

To the right of the corridor was a toilet and shower room, and to the left was a small kitchen.

There were dishes, cooking utensils, condiments, and a fridge, and the fridge was always stocked with food.

In the room, there was a bed, a side table, and a plain chair.

The closet had underwear and tracksuits in it, all of which were suited for me.

If you put your laundry in the laundry box, it was said that they would clean not only your clothing but also your bedding.

"It's fully equipped here."

However, this room could only be used for the first 30 days.

After that time, you can't enter this room anymore, and everything inside will disappear.

Even if you're wearing underwear and a tracksuit from here, you'd suddenly end up naked.

The food and condiments will also disappear, so it would be useless to take them all out on the last day.

"That girl told me to become independent within a month... That's what she meant."

"For now, I'll take a shower."

There are many things I have to do, but I want to start by freshening up.

Although I was disappointed that there was no bathtub, I quickly showered.

Of course, there were shampoo, soap, and bath towels provided.

"Phew, that's refreshing."

While wiping my wet hair with a towel, I opened the fridge.

Its contents were said to change according to the resident's preferences.

For now, I took out a bottle of carbonated water and went to the six-tatami-mat area.

In the room, there was only a bed, table, chair, and cabinet.

There apparently weren't any TVs, audio equipment, or PCs.

In the closet, two tracksuits were hanging, and five T-shirts, five pairs of boxers, and five sets of socks were stacked.

For now, I quickly dried my hair in my underwear and tracksuit, then sat on the bed with a hair dryer.

"Phew... . Now, then."

After drinking about half of the carbonated water, I finally decided to check it.

"Status!"

There was no need to say it out loud, but I felt like doing it as a commemoration.

"Oh!"

It appeared before my eyes.

sub_chapters.name: 1-2 ステータスとスキル
sub_chapters.contents:
＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊

名前：香西遥真

レベル：１

攻略：０階

ランク：10級

ＨＰ：１００／１００

ＭＰ：１００／１００

攻撃：１

防御：１１（１＋１０）

体力：１

魔力：１

精神：１

敏捷：１

器用：１

運気：１

装備

はじまりのジャージ：防＋１０

スキル

〈召喚天使〉

レベル１：単発召喚

＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊

よしよし、ちゃんと出たな。

一見してゴミみたいなステータスだけど、レベル１のときのステータスは全員同じだったりする。

簡単に説明しとくと、ＨＰとＭＰはパーセンテージで、各能力値は補正値だ。

能力値はレベルアップによって上昇し、その増え方なんかは個人差があるみたいだけどな。

たとえば筋トレをしても『攻撃』や『体力』の数値は増えないけど、筋力が向上すればちゃんと強くなる。

ステータスの能力値は、そこへ上乗せされるってわけだ。

つまり、同じレベル１で能力値が同じでも、俺と、たとえばあの部屋にいたゴツい青年とが正面から殴り合ったら、間違いなく俺はボコボコにされるってこと。

「ま、能力値についてはこんなもんでいいか」

各項目に関しては実際にダンジョンへ潜るようになってからおさらいしよう。

次に装備だが、いま着ている【はじまりのジャージ】ってのはこの部屋に用意されていたものだ。

この『防＋１０』ってのはかなり高性能らしい。

あと、キッチンにある鍋や包丁なんかも武器防具として装備できて、それぞれ『＋１０』の効果がある。

店で買えるものの中で、たとえば【青銅の剣】なんかだと『攻＋５』なので、『攻＋１０』の包丁のほうが性能がいいのだ。

まぁ使えるのが最初のひと月だけなので、初心者向けの援助だと思っておけばいいだろう。

「あとは、スキルだな」

これがダンジョン探索をするうえで最も重要な項目だ。

スキルはここへ連れてこられた人が、かならずひとつ与えられる。

〈剣術〉や〈槍術〉といった武術系のもの、〈風魔法〉

〈時空魔法〉といった魔法系のもの、〈身体能力強化〉や〈状態異常耐性〉といった補助系のものなんかが一般的らしい。

あとから習得も可能だけど、それにはいろいろ条件があるので、あと回しで。

「にしても俺のこの〈召喚天使〉ってのはなんだ？ゲームでよくある召喚魔法みたいなものか？」

どうやって使えばいいんだろう？

とりあえず口に出してみるか……。

「よーし、じゃあ……〈召喚天使〉！」

俺が言い終えるや、目の前に光が現れた。

「おお、なんだぁ！？」

それはどんどん大きく、そして明るくなり、やがて俺は目を開けていられなくなる。

しばらく目を閉じていると、やがてまぶたの向こう側が徐々に暗くなっていくのを感じたので、おそるおそる目を開く。

「お、おお……？」

目の前に、真っ白な翼を広げた、白いドレスの女性が立っていた。

ドレスといっても、シンプルなデザインのものだ。

プラチナブロンドの髪に、透き通るような白い肌。

目は閉じられているが、それでも彼女が美人なのはわかる。

そして背中には白く大きな翼があった。

なるほど、天使といっていい容姿だ。

バサッと翼がはためく。

大きくしなやかな動作によって、柔らな風が巻き起こった。

羽根がヒラヒラと舞い散ったが、それらは床に落ちる前にふわりと淡い光りを宿して消えた。

まさに、天使という名にふさわしい存在だった。

しばらくじっと佇んでいた女性の瞳が、ゆっくりと開いた。

まぶたの向こうから現れたアイスブルーの瞳が、俺の視線を捉える。

すると、彼女はにっこりと微笑んだ。

やばい、まじ天使……！！

そして彼女はおもむろに口を開く。

「やっほーご主人さま、はじめましてー。〈召喚天使〉のセラフィーナ見参だよー。気軽にセラって呼んでねっ！」

そう言うと、セラと名乗ったその女性は、目の横あたりにピースサインを出し、軽く首を傾けて舌先をペロッと出して笑った。

……あれー、なんか第一印象とキャラがちがうなぁ。

「ふぅ……さてと、もういいかなー」

天使が少しだけ疲れたように言うと、広げていた白い翼が閉じられていく。

その大半が背中に隠れるほど折りたたまれたところで、翼そのものが完全に消えた。

「あ、あれ……翼は？」

「んー、出してると疲れるから、しまっちゃったー。えへっ」

セラはそう言うと、再び首を傾げてペロリと舌を出した。

（……まじ天使）

彼女の天使っぷりに、翼の有無は関係なかった。

translation.en:
**********

Name: Haruma Kozai

Level: 1

Floor Cleared: 0

Rank: Grade 10

HP: 100/100

MP: 100/100

Attack: 1

Defense: 11 (1+10)

Stamina: 1

Magic: 1

Spirit: 1

Agility: 1

Dexterity: 1

Luck: 1

Equipment

Jersey of the Beginning: Def +10

Skills

Summon Angel

Level 1: Single Summon

**********

Well, well, it worked as intended.

At first glance, the stats may look like garbage, but everyone starts with the same stats at level 1.

To put it simply, HP and MP are percentages, and each attribute listed is a bonus value.

Attribute values will increase as you level up, and the rate at which they increase varies from person to person.

For example, even if you work out and don't see an increase in "Attack" or "Stamina" values, you'll still grow stronger as your physical strength improves.

The status attribute values are bonuses applied on top of that.

In other words, even if two people are at level 1 with the same attribute values, I would definitely get beaten up if I were to engage in a face-to-face brawl with, for instance, the burly youth in that room over there.

"Well, I guess these attribute values are fine."

I'll review the details of each attribute when I actually start exploring the dungeons.

Next is equipment, and what I'm currently wearing is the "Jersey of the Beginning," which was provided in this room.

The "Def +10" on this jersey is supposed to be quite high-performance.

Also, the pots and kitchen knives in the kitchen can be equipped as weapons and armor, each with a "+10" bonus.

Among the items that can be bought at a store, a "Bronze Sword," for example, only has "Atk +5", making the "+10" kitchen knife a better choice.

Well, it's only usable for the first month, so I guess it's just beginner-friendly aid.

"Now, onto the Skills."

This is the most crucial aspect when it comes to exploring dungeons.

Each person brought to this place is given a skill.

Skills such as "Swordsmanship" and "Spear Technique" for martial arts, or "Wind Magic" and "Space-Time Magic" for magic, as well as "Physical Ability Enhancement" and "Status Condition Resistance" for supplementary skills seem to be most common.

You can learn new skills later, but there are various conditions for that, so I'll save it for later.

"But what is this 'Summon Angel' of mine? Is it like a typical summoning magic found in games?"

How do I use it?

For now, I'll try saying it out loud...

"Alright, then... Summon Angel!"

As soon as I finish speaking, a light appears before my eyes.

"Wow, what is this!?"

The light grows brighter and larger, and eventually, I can no longer keep my eyes open.

After closing my eyes for a while, I can slowly feel the darkness behind my eyelids fading, so I hesitantly open my eyes.

"W-wow...?"

Standing before me is a woman in a white dress, her pure white wings spread wide.

The dress is a simple design.

With platinum blonde hair and translucent white skin, I can tell she's beautiful even with her eyes closed.

And on her back, there are large, white wings.

Indeed, she has the appearance befitting an angel.

Her wings flap with a rustle.

With their smooth, large movements, a gentle breeze is stirred.

Feathers flutter down, but before they can fall to the floor, they softly vanish, filled with a pale light.

She truly is a being befitting the name angel.

After standing still for a while, the woman's eyes slowly open.

The ice-blue eyes that appear from behind her eyelids capture my gaze.

Then, she smiles warmly.

This is bad, she's a real angel...!!

And then, she slowly opens her mouth.

"Yoo-hoo, Master, nice to meet you! I am Seraphina, the Summoned Angel. Feel free to call me Sera!"

Upon saying that, the woman who introduced herself as Sera flashes a peace sign beside her eye, tilts her head slightly and sticks her tongue out with a grin.

...Huh? Somehow, her personality is different from my first impression of her.

"Phew... Alright, I guess that's enough."

As the angel speaks with a hint of fatigue, her white wings begin to fold.

As they fold enough to be mostly concealed behind her back, the wings disappear entirely.

"H-hey... What happened to your wings?"

"Hmm, I got tired keeping them out, so I put them away. Hehe."

Sera says that and once again tilts her head and sticks her tongue out.

(...She's a real angel.)

Her angelic presence was undeniable, regardless of whether she had wings or not.

sub_chapters.name: 1-3 召喚天使セラ
sub_chapters.contents:
「隣、座っていい？」

「え？あ、うん」

「ありがとー」

ベッドに腰掛けていた俺の隣に、セラが座る。

そのとき、ふわりと甘い香りがあたりを漂った。

「お名前、聞いてもいいかな？」

「えっと、香西遥真」

「へぇーハルマくんっていうんだ」

不意に名前を呼ばれ、ドキリとする。

「じゃあこれからハルマくんのこと、ご主人さまって呼ぶね！」

「いや名前で呼ばんのかいっ！」

思わずつっこむと、セラはきょとんと目を見開いた。

反射的につっこんで、ひかれてしまったのかと危惧したが、ほどなく彼女はケタケタと笑い始めた。

「あははははっ！ご主人さまったらおもしろーいっ！」

よかった、笑ってくれて……。

まぁ、こんなきれいな娘にご主人さまと呼ばれるのも悪くないな。

彼女がひとしきり笑って落ち着いたところで、俺は口を開いた。

でも、おかげで緊張せずに話せるのかな。

彼女が、スキル……？

「ごめん、もう少し聞きたいんだけど」

「うん、どんどん聞いていいよー」

「〈召喚天使〉って、天使を召喚するスキルじゃないの？」

「んー、それだったら〈天使召喚〉とかになるんじゃないかなー？わかんないけど」

あー、それもそうか。

「そういえば、えっと、セラフィーナさん」

「セラだよー」

「あ、うん、セラさんは」

「んーん。なにが出るかはお楽しみだよー」

これってもしや……。

「試しにいまなにか召喚してもらえる？」

「召喚には対価が必要だねー」

「対価？それってお金とか？」

「もちろんお金でもいいよー」

「お金でも……？ほかにはなにを対価にできる？」

お金と言われても、いまは無一文なんだよな。

あとで手続きをすれば準備金はもらえるらしいけど。

「んーご主人さまの場合だと、たとえばＨＰやＭＰを消費するとか？」

とりあえずはＨＰあたりで――。

「ねぇねぇご主人さま？」

「ん？」

すると俺の考えを邪魔するかのように、セラが話しかけてきた。

か、顔が近い……！

「さっきから気になってたんだけどー、それってもしかしてー？」

ジャージの膨らみを見れば、その内側がどうなっているのかなんて一目瞭然だ。

質問を続けようとした俺の口は、柔らかな唇によって塞がれた。

translation.en:
"Can I sit next to you?"

"Eh? Ah, sure."

"Thank you!"

Sera takes a seat next to me on the bed.

At that moment, a sweet scent fills the air.

"May I ask your name?"

"Uhm, Haruma Kozai."

"Hee— So you're Haruma-kun."

I flinch when she suddenly calls me by name.

"From now on, I'll call you Master!"

"Why not just call me by my name!"

I couldn't help but retort, and Sera opened her eyes wide in surprise.

I thought I unintentionally put her off, but she soon began laughing heartily.

"Ahahahaha! Master, you're so funny!"

I'm glad she's laughing...

Well, it's not bad to be called Master by such a beautiful girl.

Once she finished laughing and calmed down, I opened my mouth.

"I have a question."

"Sure, go ahead."

Her reactions are always so light...

But that might make it easier to talk without tension.

Normally, one would be tense around such a beautiful person.

"So, you're an angel?"

"That's right."

"Was I able to summon you with my skill?"

"I guess that's how it works."

"So the Summon Angel skill means I can summon you?"

"Nope."

"Eh, it's not?"

"Yes. I'm the skill itself."

"......Huh?"

She is... the skill...?

"Sorry, but I want to ask a few more questions."

"Sure, go ahead and ask whatever you want."

"Isn't the Summon Angel skill for summoning angels?"

"Hmm, I think it'd be called Angel Summoning or something if that was the case. I don't really know."

Ah, that makes sense.

"By the way, uh, Serafina-san?"

"Sera."

"Ah, right, Sera-san is..."

"You don't need to add 'san.' I just told you to call me Sera, didn't I?"

Sera said that and furrowed her brow, puffing her cheeks in an exaggerated manner.

So cunning... But so cute!!

"A-ah, sorry, sorry. Anyway, Sera, like..."

"Nfu, what is it?"

When I call her Sera, she smiles like her mood has completely changed.

...She's really cute!

"You introduced yourself as a Summon Angel at the beginning, right?"

"Yup."

"Does that mean you can summon something?"

"That's right."

I see. So it's not a "summon an angel" skill, but rather an "angel summons" skill.

"What exactly can you summon?"

"Money or items, I guess."

"I see... So do you summon what I want?"

"Well, it's always a surprise!"

Is it like a random item summon?

If so, this could be...

"Can you try summoning something right now?"

"A price is necessary for summoning."

"A price? Like money?"

"Money is fine, of course."

"Money is fine...? What else can be used as a price?"

Even if she mentions money, I'm currently broke.

I've heard that I will receive some funds after I go through some procedures.

"Hmm, in Master's case, how about consuming HP or MP, for example?"

"How much consumption is needed to summon something?"

"It depends on the value of the item."

I see, as I thought...

"The bigger the price, the more valuable... no, the rarer the item that can be summoned?"

"Right on target!"

--So it's a gacha.

By paying a price and rolling the gacha, you can randomly obtain something. That's the effect of the Summon Angel skill.

Now I understand why she herself is the skill.

So what should I use to pay the price...?

For now, let's use HP--.

"Hey, hey, Master?"

"Hmm?"

As if to interrupt my thoughts, Sera speaks up.

Her face is so close!

"By any chance, is that due to Sera?"

With a somewhat mischievous smile, she stares intently at my crotch.

One glance at the bulge in my sweatpants, and it's clear what's going on underneath.

"Uh, no, this is..."

I try to lean forward slightly.

After all, Sera is incredibly beautiful, smells wonderful, and her close proximity makes her warmth evident.

Her dress is pretty revealing, too.

From the large opening at her chest, the soft valley of her plush, presumably G-cup breasts is clearly visible.

In fact, depending on her posture, it looks like even the top could be seen.

Her hips were slim, but her bottom seemed firm.

Her plump thighs peeked out from the slit in her dress...

Any man would be aroused in this situation!

"Could it be that it happened because of Sera?"

What other reason could there be?

Age doesn't really matter at this point.

"I'm a grown man, of course it's because of you. It's only natural to react this way when there's a beautiful woman like Sera nearby."

When I stubbornly say that, Sera's eyes widen, and before long, her cheeks become flushed. Simultaneously, her expression softens.

Her eyes narrow and her mouth slightly quirks upward.

Her smile is absolutely bewitching.

"Hehe, that makes me happy..."

Murmuring to herself, she wraps her slender arm around my neck.

Her bountiful breasts press gently against me.

Not even the "Defense+10" stands a chance against their softness.

"Hey, Sera...?"

"Yes, Master?"

The brightness in Sera's voice turns sultry.

"How about paying with my body?"

"With... your body?"

As I remain facing Sera, I'm practically frozen.

She tightens her arm around my neck and draws her face closer.

The angel's breath reaches my nostrils.

"What do you mean by—"

Before I can finish my question, our lips meet in a soft kiss.

sub_chapters.name: 1-4 セラの望む対価
sub_chapters.contents:
「はむ……んちゅる……れろぉ」

間抜けに半開きとなっていた俺の口に、天使の舌がゆっくりと入ってくる。

「れろぉ……ちゅぷ……あむぅ」

キスを、している……？

えっと、なんだったっけ？

でも、こんな美人が気持ちよくしてほしいと言っているんだ。

「あん、ご主人さま――んむぅ……！」

今度は俺のほうから唇を奪う。

そんなことはどうでもいい。

もしセラが天使じゃなく悪魔だったとして、そして彼女を抱くことで何かしらのペナルティがあるとしても、俺はもう止まる気はない。

こんないい女を抱けるのなら、死んでもいい。

絹のようなすべすべの布地越しに、豊満な膨らみを撫でる。

「あんっ……んむ……れろれろ……」

胸で感じたのか、セラは短く喘いだが、すぐに唇を密着させ、舌を絡めてきた。

俺は口内をまさぐられながら、天使のおっぱいを撫で回し、揉みしだいた。

「あむぅ……んぅ……んっ、んっ……！」

ぷっくりと膨らんだ乳首を、ドレスの上からこすってやると、セラはピクピクと身体を震わせた。

ドレス越しの乳房をひとしきり堪能した俺は、胸元から手を入れ、直接乳房に触れた。

絹のようなドレスの布地に勝るとも劣らない滑らかな素肌の感触。

さわっているうちに汗が滲んできたのか、柔肌が皮膚に張り付く。

「んぁ……あっあっ！はぁ……はぁ……」

乳房をまさぐっているうちに感度がよくなってきたのか、セラの顔が離れた。

少し浅い呼吸を繰り返しながら、彼女は潤んだ瞳を上目遣いにこちらへ向ける。

そろそろかな、と思い、ドレスの肩紐に手をかけると、セラは俺の首に回していた腕をほどき、だらりと垂らした。

ノースリーブのドレスをずらし、乳房を露出させる。

「――っ！？」

思わず息を呑んだ。

ドレスをずらし、腰のあたりまで露出された天使のスタイルは、完璧だった。

華奢な肩、ほっそりとしていても痩せているという印象のない腕。

腰に向かって細くなっていく身体のライン。

視線を少し戻すと、大きな乳房が目に飛び込んでくる。

適度に張りがあり、かといって垂れているわけでもない。

先端にある桜色の突起も、大きすぎず、小さすぎず。

まさに神が作りたもう理想の――少なくとも俺にとって――体つきだった。

じんわりと汗の滲む、うっすらと赤らんだ胸元が、呼吸に合わせて上下に動く。

それに合わせて、ほんのわずかではあるが、乳房が揺れていた。

「きれいだ……」

そんな言葉が、自然と口から漏れる。

「ふふふ、ありがとぉ」

少し照れくさそうに微笑むセラの乳房を掴んだ。

「あん……」

両手で左右の乳房を揉みながら、顔を近づけ、片方の乳房へと舌を伸ばす。

「ひぃんっ……んっ……あっ……」

ぷっくりと膨らんだ乳首を、ちろちろと舌先で転がしてやると、セラはピクピクと震えた。

舌先からは、少ししょっぱい味が伝わってくる。

乳房にむしゃぶりつきながら、鼻で呼吸をしていると、さっきまで漂っていた甘い匂いに少し酸味が混じってきたように思えた。

どうやら天使といっても、人並みに汗をかくらしい。

「あっ……おっぱい……きもちぃよぉ……！」

柔らかな感触と、温かい体温、コリコリとした乳首の硬さ、汗の味、そして匂い。

完璧な造形の乳房を楽しみながら、俺は片方の手を下に下げていく。

スリットから手を入れてスカートをたくしあげ、股間に触れる。

――にちゃ……。

ねっとりとした粘液が、指にまとわりついた。

sub_chapters.name: 1-5 その手から現れたものは
sub_chapters.contents:

すでに愛液まみれになっている粘膜を指先で撫でると、セラは大きく喘いだ。

title: ElysionOnline～ドラゴニュートと召喚師～
author: とんし
description:
掛け持ちバイトのしすぎで、入院した高校生、近衛 誠吾（このえ せいご）は家族と学校からバイト禁止令が出されて、暇になってしまう。

そんな彼に学校の友人から暇なら今度発売される新作のVRMMORPG「ElysionOnline（エリュシオンオンライン）」をやってみないか誘われる。

どうせやることがないので、ゲームで暇つぶしするのもいいかと考え、初めてのVRゲームをプレイすることを決める。

ゲームを始めた誠吾はアバター名をタクトと名付け、召喚師サモナーとして、プレイを始める。そして始めて召喚をした召喚獣は竜人族の可愛い少女だった。リリーと名付けたタクトはリリーと共にEOの世界に旅立つ。

そして数多くのバイトをした彼はVRの世界で才能を発揮する。ゲームが楽しくなってきた彼はいつの間にか立派なゲーマーに成長していく。

■『マンガUP！』様でコミックス完結しました。

■『めちゃコミック』様でコミックス全巻が配信中です。

■『ElysionOnline～ドラゴニュートと召喚師～』のコミックス一巻、二巻、三巻が発売中です！

現在一日空けて小説更新中です。

title: HP之命运螺旋
author: 眉毛笑弯弯
description:
穿透层叠的空间、拨乱时间的线，迷茫的旅行者，你来自何方？当哈利·波特从时空的乱流中走回到原点，遇到曾经的自己，以及那些重要的人们，一切会发生怎样的转折？当继承了佩弗利尔三兄弟的姓氏前面，又冠以格林德沃家族之名，揉合了家族、血统、父母和自身构成的姓名之咒，会对一个人造成怎样的影响？命运的又一次轮回……或者，是一条看似时时回顾留恋，却永远曲折向前的螺旋线？ HP同人看多之后的产物，说不清道不明的怨念之作。因此，当看到似曾相识的人物名、姓和故事走向，请别生气，别上火，耐心再看一章，如此。开头也许无聊，中间大约拖沓，故事多半俗套，人物基本走形，更新肯定不快……唯一可以确保的，此坑必然很深、很深。
**********封面中央文字——What did I care if numbers of nameless and faceless people and creatures were slaughtered in the vague future, if in the here and now you were alive, and well, and happy? I never dreamed that I would have such a person on my hands.alive，well，happy——邓布利多在乎的，也是我所希望给予的。命运的螺旋线，但愿少一点痛苦和牺牲。 **********眉毛滴新浪微博，直接搜“眉毛笑弯弯”即可

description_translation.en:
Through layers of space, interfering with the lines of time, perplexed traveler, where are you from? When Harry Potter walked back to the origin from the turbulence of time and space, encountering his past self and those important people, what sudden changes will occur? When inheriting the surname of the Peverell brothers, crowned with the name of the Gryffindor family, blending the curse of family, bloodlines, parents and self-identity, what kind of impact will it have on a person? Another cycle of destiny... or a spiral line that seems to always look back and cherish the past, but actually twists forward for eternity? A product of reading too many Harry Potter fanfictions, an incomprehensible and spiteful work. Therefore, when you see familiar character names, surnames and storylines, please don't get angry or worked up, be patient and read another chapter. The beginning may be boring, the middle may be dragging, the story may be clichéd, the characters may be stereotypical, and the updates may not be fast... but the only thing that can be guaranteed is that this hole is definitely very deep, very deep.
**********Central text in the cover---What did I care if numbers of nameless and faceless people and creatures were slaughtered in the vague future, if in the here and now you were alive, and well, and happy? I never dreamed that I would have such a person on my hands.alive，well，happy---What Dumbledore cared about, it's also what I hope to give. The spiral line of destiny, I hope there will be less pain and sacrifice. **********Smiling Eyebrows has a Sina Weibo account, search "Smiling Eyebrows" directly.

translated_name.en: A New Fork in the Road

sub_chapters.name: 一个新的开始
sub_chapters.contents:
“这么说，你承认这是一场背叛喽，罗文德·格里恩先生？”





将视线从窗外收回来，深色西装的年青男子不紧不慢地说道。





这是一个冬日明媚的下午，光线充足但不耀眼。典型的商务办公室，窗户很大，屋里浅色的柚木家具让室内显出一种令人温暖的明亮。但是，罗文德·格里恩看不清男子的脸，或许是因为他正背对着站在窗前，面容被自然地蒙上一片阴影。只是这一句问话平淡语气当中透出来的笃定，让他由衷地感觉到背脊上那一股原本隐隐的寒气突然加强，并开始疯狂地乱蹿。





“我很抱歉……但是佩弗利尔先生，您刚才是在说……‘背叛’？”





“非常确切。这正是我的说法。那么，你承认了？”





“哦，不！”惊喘一声，罗文德后退一小步，“哦，不。”他又说了一遍，“这不是背叛，先生！我的意思是说，我……我并没有……”





“你窃取了普林特复方药草合剂的配方，并将其透露了蒙斯塔顿家族，藉此获得蒙斯塔顿制药公司的一个主管职位，以及一万金加隆的额外报酬。这样窃取自家企业机密、利惠对方竞争公司的行为，我认为用‘背叛’这个词恰如其分。而且，找不到更适合定义它的字眼。”





双手负在身后，说话间青年身体姿势没有丝毫的动作改变，却让罗文德有一种对方正在慢慢逼近的感觉，额头上开始冒出汗来。“这，佩弗利尔先生，可是……格林德沃家族在蒙斯塔顿是有股份的，两家的合作……”





“是安得列·佩特森持有蒙斯塔顿的部分股份，不是格林德沃家族。他个人是蒙斯塔顿的股东，当然，股东中非常小的一个，持有的部分几乎无足轻重。或许我应该说，这大概正是他所以这么做的原因：他对格林德沃家族的企业没有丝毫的影响力，所以希望在家族之外寻求机会发展，而无所谓那是否本家族目前最大的竞争对手。”阴影里，青年嘴角勾起一抹冷笑，“至于格里恩先生你说的合作，很遗憾，格林德沃和蒙斯塔顿近五十年来没有过任何的合作，家族的姓氏和探索研究的方向决定了彼此只可能作为对手存在。”





“可是……”





“没有什么‘可是’，格里恩先生——让您到这里不是来解释自己行为的。只是为了给可怜的老巴顿先生一个交代和安慰，他不需要为处心积虑的阴谋设计承担不应当的罪责。至于您，格里恩先生，”青年的声音冷得胜过窗外的寒风，“既然您已经在蒙斯塔顿找好了位置，那就立刻去就任吧。格林德沃再不欢迎你，一切格林德沃所属之地也不允许你再踏上半步。——我以格林德沃的名义，驱逐你，罗文德·J·格里恩。”





罗文德面色惨白，嘴唇哆嗦着，又狠狠咬住。这才慢慢鞠了一个躬：“感谢您的宽宏，佩弗利尔先生。”不等青年挥手，就抓了门边帽架上的窄边镶貂皮帽，跌跌撞撞冲出门去。





——他居然活着从那个男人的办公室走出来了，这真是不可思议。





***





“我不能想象，你居然会被影响成这个样子。”看着罗文德狠狠灌下第五杯火焰威士忌，马钉维摩终于忍不住说。“你只是去了一趟他的办公室，递交辞呈和解释理由。即使知道你全部所做的，他也仅仅是把你从格林德沃驱除，而这几乎是早就预料到的……我是说，事实上，他并没有对你做什么，特别的、危险的、任何违反巫师甚至麻瓜法律的事情。”





“该死的他确实没有。”罗文德苍白着脸，酒精在眼睛里燃烧，“但你同样也该死的不能想象，面对那样一个人是什么感觉——被他眼睛盯着的时候，我感觉那目光就像是刀子把我一片片剖开；他甚至不需要使用任何魔力，他的眼神就已经足够杀人了！”





马丁摇头：“我的确不能想象——如果他仅仅靠眼神就能够有这样的威慑力的话，你又为什么会这样做？不管怎么说，安得列以前从没有表现得像是个好的合作对象。”





罗文德又要了一杯酒，不过，这一次没有立即喝干。“因为我疯了……我疯狂地需要钱，需要上升，需要有一个出头的机会。安得列能够提供这个。”





马丁皱起眉头：“在格林德沃难道不能？你以前不止一次说过，老巴顿欣赏你，愿意栽培你。”



“或许我以前是说过，不止一次地，但现在，哦，不！”放下酒杯，罗文德表情烦躁，“当佩弗利尔接管了一切，当佩弗利尔抓住了一切，当这个莫名其妙不知道从哪里蹦出来的佩弗利尔插手了‘老格林’，就什么都变了——什么都没有了！”





“佩弗利尔是优秀的商人，而且，在魔药制造和发明方面同样擅长。”马丁指出。两个人在一起的好处，就是当一个人烦躁时，另一个可以起到开解和冷静的作用。虽然，他和罗文德之间的交情也没有到无话不谈的地步，不过，耐心的聆听和分析还是可以提供的。当然，这是说，今天他心情意外的好，而且，有整整一个晚上空闲时间的情况下，他并不十分反对和一个努力想把自己灌醉的郁闷的人说些或许有意义和帮助的话。





“是啊，这是所有人都知道的事情：佩弗利尔非常优秀，他擅长魔药，更擅长赚钱——像最勤奋的麻瓜一样。”





马丁伸手拿掉罗文德的酒杯。并不是因为他已经醉了，而是因为他显出的不甘和愠怒，使得马丁不得不为自己的衬衫担心。“他对待麻瓜的态度确实和一般世家贵族不太相同，尤其，在他还是个格林德沃的时候。但赚钱这件事是无分巫师和麻瓜的。”





“他不是个格林德沃！”罗文德意外激烈地高声反对，“没有人知道他的来历——直到老狄休斯在年中会议上突然把他介绍给所有主管和经理，没有一个人认识他，就像是平空从天上掉下来的！虽然格林德沃在几十年来没落了，家族之间各个家庭联系得很少，可是像他这个年纪的男孩……谁也想不到可能的来历，甚至查遍几十年来各支的行动，也没一个得出结果。而且，他不具备任何格林德沃家族的特征，我敢打赌，就连我身上格林德沃的血也比他多得多！”





马丁微微笑一笑：“你的外婆是老狄休斯的堂妹，你当然是格林德沃的血脉。”罗文德重重喘一口气，马丁又说，“但是，家族的首领是老狄休斯，他的意志就是绝对，没有人能够违抗，或者仅仅是怀疑。”





“是，所以当他把这个肮脏的从暗巷子里捡来的……丢进‘格林’和‘伍德’的时候，没有人能够提出反对。”将火焰威士忌一饮而尽，罗文德表情阴郁地说道。“同样的，当他立下遗嘱，把格林德沃的主掌权留给佩弗利尔，由他决定是扶立傀儡的家主还是他自己直接取而代之，也没有人能够做哪怕一点点的挣扎。”





“那一定是一个血缘魔法。”





罗文德点头，然后又摇头：“不，我不知道。谁也不知道老狄休斯的魔法，也没有人能够探察到他的魔力底线。只是，他做的太完美，滴水不漏——一切魔法测试、程序考核还有文本鉴定，都表明老狄休斯自己的意愿，在他死后，他名下的所有财产、他手中的所有格林德沃家族产业的股份和控制权力都归哈利·佩弗利尔所有。为了保证佩弗利尔对家族事务的话语权和最终裁定权，他甚至启动家族秘法，给一个外人加上了‘格林德沃’的名字，然后添进家谱里。”





惊讶于自己听到的新的信息，马丁脸上却还很平静。“哦，那么，好吧。狄休斯指定了他，他就是继承人，我们都知道这一点。他完全拥有‘老格林’和‘老伍德’。所以问题是，这和老巴顿、和你，又是什么关系？他插手了什么事？你以前说的不是很明白。”





“他插手了一切——一切，你明白吗？”罗文德怒气冲冲地吼道，“改变所有传统药品的配方，修改制作方式，他甚至更换掉所有熬药的坩埚和盛放药品的容器！”





“事实证明，他的这些改变很成功。你们生产和制造的所有种类的魔药，在药效或是口味方面都有了或多或少的改进，它们受到从专业人士到巫师大众广泛的肯定和欢迎。”





“可是他毁掉了制药的传统！他把制药工场变成了实验工地！他还在玷污传统魔法物品的制造工艺，将精益求精变成粗制滥造——他甚至弄来麻瓜们的玩意儿，说那叫‘机床’……‘车床’，用它来加工制造魔杖！”





“得了吧，罗文德，谁都知道佩弗利尔用改造后的麻瓜机器生产他需要的初级产品，这让许多传统的巫师完全看他不起。可是，同样的，老格林在三年之内占领了几乎整个德国的常用魔药市场，而老伍德……”马丁顿住了，眼睛看着身边酒吧里进进出出的年轻人，“每个人都只有一根匹配自己、伴随一生的魔杖，但并不是每个人都付得起一根命定魔杖的加隆。而且，日常生活有那么多可能会给魔杖造成损害，而我们事实上并不需要追求每一道魔法释放的完美……没有人能够否认，老伍德提供的那些平价魔杖具备足够广阔的市场。”





“你一直在为佩弗利尔说话。如果那样崇拜他，为什么不直接拜倒在他脚下？”





“因为我不会那样做，他也不需要我那样做。”马丁淡淡回答道，“老格林、老伍德、老巴顿都是敢于尝试改变的人。佩弗利尔给他们带来改变，他们也确实顺应着改变了——他们不再拘泥于传统的工作方式。而你却不再适应这种……”





“将基本缓和剂中主料的月长石和嚏根草比例按照1:9、2:8、3:7……不断变化试验，然后记录下每一种从制作到完成的全部状态和最终药效？谁都知道最适合的比例是什么，这是巫师三年级课本上就写明确的！让我适应这样浪费材料的无意义的工作？哦，绝不！”





皱眉看着罗文德愤怒的高声抱怨，马丁庆幸自己布下了双重的静音咒和忽视咒。端起自己的威士忌喝了一口，慢慢说道：“罗文德，如果你还是魔药学徒，你应该知道最基本的魔药训练方式。”





“就是做佩弗利尔的傻事？新的魔药是不会用这种白痴单纯的方法试验出来的！传统的配方经过了漫长的时间考验，我们可以有效把握从生产到使用的每一个环节……”





马丁任由他滔滔不绝。到罗文德终于说累了停下来喝酒润喉，才慢慢道：“那么，普林特合剂配方，又是怎么一回事？”





罗文德脸一下子白了。





沉默一会儿，马丁才又开口：“不管怎样，佩弗利尔在魔药上有他的一套，在其他魔法使用上也是。而且他具有商业头脑——我听说，在正式接手‘格林’、‘伍德’之前，他就已经以老狄休斯秘书的身份，代理他在葛雷特巴赫的各种业务了。而就一般所知，十年前，格林德沃家族已经在破产边缘，只是葛雷特巴赫家族因为世交关系没有逼迫过紧而已。”





“葛雷特巴赫……哼，银行家，这些无原则的吸血虫。”罗文德低声嘟囔一句。“你是说，那个肮脏的从街上捡来的小子……是格林德沃的大恩人？”





马丁摇头：“怎么是这个意思？只不过，有些事实无法否认。你适应不了变化的‘老格林’，如此而已。”顿一顿，“你从巴顿那边套走了配方，他现在怎样？”





“你在问我们的导师学徒关系？发现的第一时间，他就把我逐出门墙了。”罗文德阴郁地回答，“我打赌他根本不会为失去一个愚蠢的、不能理解他任何一种新创造的学徒感到任何遗憾。而梅林保佑，佩弗利尔的宽宏大量足够让他再没有一点心理负担地继续他的创造发明。”





马丁叹一口气，想说些什么，罗文德已经继续：“你不用为我遗憾，事实上，我已经学到了想学的一切，这些足够我在任何一家魔药制作工场胜任主管的位置。而我也没有损失，安得列虽然不是太靠得住，但蒙斯塔顿家族还是有信誉的。”





“你都已经安排好了。”





“早就安排好了——我不可能把筹码全押在一个人身上，尤其，一个臭名昭著的花花公子，格林德沃家族真正的败类。”罗文德轻蔑地撇撇嘴，“甚至，还不如佩弗利尔。”





马丁又叹了一口气，然后微笑起来：“这显然不是一个高的评价。”





“因为那个败类只是藉着血缘的相近而站得比任何人更接近权位宝座。我几乎高兴地看到佩弗利尔不费吹灰之力就毁掉那个混账的白日梦。”





“可是，你现在却还在跟他合作。”马丁尖锐地说，“而且你还彻底地惹上佩弗利尔。”





“已经结束了。”罗文德皱着眉，脸上慢慢露出疲倦的表情，“不，马丁，佩弗利尔以格林德沃的名义驱逐了我，这是他给予的惩罚、要求付出的代价，针对罪名‘背叛’……虽然我坚持只有贵族的血液才能够体会巫师真正的信仰，但他确实尊重这种荣耀。所以我并不担心今后的去留——挑起佩弗利尔的怒火，现在那是安得列的事情了。”





罗文德眼里那种幸灾乐祸的怜悯看起来非常真诚……马丁不禁有点迷惑：“事实上，罗文德，我依然不太明白……”





“什么？”





“你恨佩弗利尔，当然，这毫无疑问，他改变了一切，毁了你原本的生活。”见罗文德点头，马丁继续道，“然而，相比起恨，你显然更怕他……更敬畏他。”





“敬畏”这个词出口，马丁就看到罗文德身子一抖，随即苍白的脸泛起不正常的粉红。“你说……我怕他？”





马丁点头。





“格林德沃家的子孙，会害怕？你知道我们——知道这个名字只会令别人害怕！我怎么会怕佩弗利尔！”





“现在，显然是。”马丁的声音温和而坚定。“告诉我为什么，罗文德，你为什么要害怕哈利•佩弗利尔？诚然，他是一个很优秀的巫师，精通魔法和魔药，而且善于经商。但，所有认识佩弗利尔的人——我是说，像我们这些因为生意方面产生交集的人，都认为他总体上很温和。格林德沃产业的那些工人们也大都很喜欢这个所谓‘没有一点贵族老爷架子’的雇主。不管是公众还是亲近朋友，对他的评价有聪明、冷静、温和、忍耐、亲切，也有认为他在商场上狡诈圆滑、手段老辣，但，没有人会认为他危险。可是，你却害怕他，而且今天的见面对你造成的影响那么大……”





罗文德颓然低头：“你是一个敏锐的家伙，马钉维摩。”顿一顿，抬起头来，“只是，你不知道我为什么害怕他，但是就连我自己也不完全明白。我只知道，和他双眼对视是可怕的，而他移开视线让我有死里逃生的感觉。”





***





罗文德·格里恩最终没有喝醉，他在午夜的时候走出酒馆。





这或许是因为兴奋之外到底还怀抱忐忑，另外，和马钉维摩的交谈也是很重要的因素。





“你敬畏他……你为什么害怕佩弗利尔？”





罗文德讽刺似的勾起嘴角。





马钉维摩，又是一个对佩弗利尔产生类似兴趣的人。





优秀的巫师，聪明、冷静，有耐心和忍耐力。性情在大多数情况下温和，待人亲切。精通魔法和魔药，善于经商，商场上显得狡诈圆滑，手段老辣。一个靠独自一人力量就把格林德沃家族从破产线上拉回来的奇迹小子，老狄休斯挖掘和培养出的出色的继承人——马钉维摩的评价，当然也是一般人对佩弗利尔的认识。





“没有人以为他危险”。





但是，就像他从来不能明白，因为他不可能体会到自己所体会的：哈利·佩弗利尔是一个多可怕的人物，那是只有当挑战了他底线、并且直接承受他怒火的人才能真正感觉。





有些直觉是必须相信的，尤其那些来自于危险的信号。格林德沃擅长分辨这种信号，而且，自从五十年前那位黑魔王因为“顾念家族亲缘”，选择将站在他对立面的两支投入了纽蒙迦德而不是直接杀死他们全家，这种能力有了更深刻的加强。





佩弗利尔是危险的。





他从来没有见过哪个巫师有这样的震慑力——他也从来没有遇见或是听闻过，有哪一个三十岁的年轻巫师能像哈利·佩弗利尔一样强大。





在魔药制作工场学徒时，他就见识到佩弗利尔的无杖魔法，同时，也注意到在很多方面，佩弗利尔施展魔法同样很少借助声音。不仅仅是在熬制魔药的时候，佩弗利尔似乎习惯于在没有介质的条件下施展魔法，而这，需要非常强大的魔法力量以及惊人的魔法控制能力，向来只有最高明的巫师才能做到。





他只要把这种力量放出一点点，不用说更多话作更多事，就能给自己无限的压力。





如果他愿意，他可以轻易地读取自己的思想、控制自己的言行。





他只是从来没有这样做过而已——罗文德现在完全不怀疑这一点：经过了今天下午的办公室会见，他终于知道长久以来自己刻意忽略了的东西。





有些人是不能挑衅的，不论他们看上去多么温和无害。佩弗利尔从来就没有喜欢或者欣赏过自己，而且，明确地表达了在他的管理下“无能与不合拍者不得上位”，斩断了自己以及另一些族人继续按部就班混日子的妄想。但是，他并没有做任何过分的事情，也没有一开始就取消了这些原本为族人家人增设的职位。经商的佩弗利尔对外老练圆滑，对内也很少显示出十足的强硬。他相当尊敬家族产业的老人儿，给予足够的看重和体恤——这一切都让他的经营管理变得顺畅，也给人一种年轻人初经大事的羞怯感。而这样的观感，又造成他年轻可欺的错觉。使得自己以为凭自己的能力机变，足以支撑那些负面的感情以及大胆的言行，长久以来漠视危险的潜在预警，固执相信自己错误的判断……终于导致，再也不可能回头。





他想起那双眼睛，他知道那应该是翠绿色的，平时偶然会微微地闪光，就像森林拥抱着的安静的湖泊。但是，当那双眼睛积聚起雷霆闪电，平静的湖面变成暴风雨喧嚣的无边汪洋……罗文德不能抑制地轻轻颤抖。





驱逐，并不是真的不愤怒不予追究，而是一种最高限度的宽宏大量的体现。从另一个角度，事实上，就是一种对无足轻重的蔑视。只是最后佩弗利尔还是警告了自己，不要试图玩弄他手中刚刚放下的霹雳。





他是一个格林德沃……猛然意识到这一点，罗文德只觉得不寒而栗。





——他做了人生最错误的决定。

translation.en:
"So, you admit this is a betrayal, Mr. Rowende Green?" 

Withdrawing his gaze from the window, the young man in the dark suit spoke unhurriedly.

It was a bright winter afternoon, with ample yet not dazzling light. The typical business office had large windows, and the light-colored teak furniture inside gave the room a warm, bright ambiance. However, Rowende Green could not see the man's face clearly, perhaps because he was standing with his back against the window and his face was naturally shadowed. The certainty revealed in such a bland inquiry made him feel the vague chill on his back suddenly intensify and start to run rampant.

"I'm sorry... But, Mr. Peverell, you just said... 'betrayal'?"

"Very precise. That's exactly what I said. So, do you admit it?"

"Oh, no!" Gasping in shock, Rowende retreated a small step, "Oh, no." He repeated, "It's not betrayal, sir! I mean, I... I didn't..."

"You stole the formula for the Print Multiple Herb Blend and revealed it to the Montstadden family, obtaining a managerial position at Montstadden Pharmaceuticals and an additional ten thousand Galleons in compensation. I think the term 'betrayal' fits perfectly for stealing corporate secrets from your own company and benefiting a competitor. Moreover, there's no better term to define it."

With his hands behind his back, the young man's posture remained unchanged while he spoke, yet Rowende felt as if he was slowly closing in, and sweat began to form on his forehead. "But, Mr. Peverell, in Montstadden...the Greenwell family has shares, and the cooperation between the two families..."

"It's Andell Patterson who holds a portion of Montstadden's shares, not the Greenwell family. He personally is a shareholder of Montstadden, albeit a small one, with an insignificant share. Perhaps I should say, this may be precisely why he did so: he had no influence over the Greenwell family's business, so he sought opportunities to develop outside the family, regardless of whether that was their current biggest competitor." A cold smile emerged from the shadows, "As for the cooperation you mentioned, Mr. Green, it's unfortunate to say that Greenwell and Montstadden haven't had any collaboration in the past fifty years; their surnames and fields of research determine they could only exist as opponents."

"But..."

"There's no 'but,' Mr. Green—your reason for coming here is not to explain your actions. It's just to make a statement and comforting the poor old Barton, so he doesn't bear responsibility for not having plotted any schemes. As for you, Mr. Green," the youth's voice was colder than the wind outside, "since you already found a position in Montstadden, take it immediately. Greenwell no longer welcomes you, and you're not allowed to set foot on any Greenwell property again. I, on behalf of Greenwell, expel you, Rowende J. Green."

Rowende's face turned pale, his lips trembled before biting down hard. Finally, he slowly bowed, "Thank you for your generosity, Mr. Peverell." Without waiting for the youth to wave his hand, he snatched his narrow-brimmed mink hat on the coat rack by the door, stumbled, and rushed out.

He couldn't believe that he had survived his encounter in that man's office.

***

"I can't imagine that you'd be influenced to this extent," looking at Rowende who fiercely downed his fifth glass of firewhiskey, Martin Demiwil finally couldn't help but speak up. "You just went to his office once to submit your resignation and explain your reasons. Even knowing everything you did, he only banished you from Greenwell, which was already anticipated... I mean, he did nothing special, dangerous, or anything against wizard or even Muggle law to you."

"Damn it, he didn't." Rowende, with a pale face, let the alcohol burn in his eyes, "But you also can't imagine what it's like to face such a man—when his eyes stared at me, his gaze was like a knife, dissecting me piece by piece; he didn't even need to use any magic, his eyes alone are murderous!"

Martin shook his head, "I truly can't imagine—if he could intimidate like that with just a gaze, why would you do this? After all, Andelle never seemed like a good collaborator."

Rowende ordered another drink but didn't down it immediately. "Because I went crazy... I desperately needed money, promotion, and a chance to succeed. Andelle could provide that."

Martin frowned, "Couldn't you get that in Greenwell? You mentioned more than once that old Barton appreciated and was willing to cultivate you."

"Maybe I did say that, more than once, but now—oh, no!" Putting down his glass, Rowende looked frustrated, "Everything changed when Peverell took over, when he seized everything, when that inexplicable Peverell interfered with the 'old Green'—there's nothing left!"

"Peverell is an excellent businessman and also skilled in creating and inventing potions," Martin pointed out. The advantage of having two people together was when one person became frustrated, the other could offer solace and calm. Although their friendship wasn't at the stage of telling each other everything, patient listening and analysis were still possible. However, today Martin was unexpectedly in a good mood, not opposing speaking some possibly helpful words to a depressed man trying to drown himself in alcohol.

"Yeah, everyone knows that: Peverell is excellent, he's good at creating potions, and he's even better at making money—like the most diligent Muggle."

Martin took away Rowende's drink, not because he was drunk, but because the frustration and anger shown made him worry about his own shirt. "His attitude towards Muggles is indeed different from that of typical purebloods, especially when he was a Greenwell. But making money is something that has nothing to do with being a wizard or a Muggle."

"He's not a Greenwell!" Rowende unexpectedly raised his voice in opposition, "No one knows his background—until old Dexius suddenly introduced him to all the directors and managers at the mid-year meeting, no one knew him; he came out of nowhere! Although the Greenwells had declined over the years, and there was little contact between families, there's no one from any branch who could possibly explain his origins. What's more, he doesn't possess any characteristics of the Greenwell family; I dare bet that even the Greenwell blood in me is much stronger than his!"

"But, you're still working with him now," Martin said sharply, "and you've completely gotten involved with Peverell."

Martin smiled faintly, "Your grandmother is Old Dhortz's cousin; of course, you carry the Grindelwald bloodline." Rowende took a deep breath, and Martin continued, "However, the family's leader is Old Dhortz, and his will is absolute. No one can resist or even doubt it."

"Yes, so when he picked up this filthy…from an alley and threw them into 'Grindel' and 'Wood,' nobody could object." Rowende downed the flaming whiskey and spoke with a gloomy expression, "Similarly, when he left his will, leaving the control of Grindelwalds to Peverell to decide whether to support a puppet family head or replace it himself, no one could struggle even a little."

"It must be a bloodline magic."

Rowende nodded, then shook his head, "No, I don't know. Nobody knows Old Dhortz's magic, nor can anyone probe his magical limit. It's just that his actions were too perfect—leaving no loopholes. All magical tests, procedural examinations, and textual verifications show that it was Old Dhortz's own will that after his death, all of his assets, shares, and control of the Grindelwald family industries would belong to Harry Peverell. To ensure Peverell's decision-making power and the ultimate authority over the family affairs, he even activated the family secret art to give an outsider the name 'Grindelwald' and added it to the family tree."

Surprised by the new information he heard, Martin remained composed. "Oh, well. Dhortz designated him, he's the heir; we all know that. He completely owns 'Old Grindel' and 'Old Woodwood.' So, what's the connection between Old Barton, you, and him? What did he meddle in? You didn't explain it before."

"He meddled in everything—everything, do you understand?" Rowende angrily roared, "He changed the formulas of all traditional potions, altered production methods, and even replaced all the cauldrons for brewing potions and containers for holding potions!"

"The fact is, these changes were successful. All types of potions produced and manufactured by you have varied improvements in efficacy and taste. They have been widely recognized and appreciated by professionals and ordinary wizards alike."

"But he destroyed traditional potion-making! He turned the potion workshop into an experimental site! He even dirtied the production process of traditional magical items, turning refinement into shoddy manufacturing—he even brought Muggle things called 'machines' and 'lathes' to process and manufacture wands!"

"Enough, Rowende. Everyone knows that Peverell uses modified Muggle machines to produce the preliminary products he needs, which many traditional wizards look down on. However, at the same time, Old Grindel took over nearly the entire German common potion market within three years, and Old Wood…" Martin paused, eyeing the young people coming in and out of the pub, "Everyone has only one wand to match themselves for a lifetime, but not everyone can afford to pay the Galleons for a destined wand. Moreover, there are so many things in daily life that can damage a wand while we don't actually need to pursue perfection in every magical release. No one can deny that Old Wood provides affordable wands with a broad market."

"You've been speaking for Peverell. If you admire him so much, why don't you just kneel at his feet?"

"Because I won't do that, and he doesn't need me to do it," Martin replied indifferently, "Old Grindel, Old Wood, and Old Barton are all people who dare to try and change. Peverell brings change to them, and they adapt to the change—they are no longer confined to traditional ways of working. But you can no longer adapt to this…"

Martin sighed, wondering what to say, but Rowende had already continued, "You don't have to pity me. In fact, I've learned everything I wanted to, and this is enough for me to be competent as a supervisor in any potion-making workshop. And I haven't lost anything. Although Andro isn't very reliable, the Montaudon family still has a reputation."

"You've arranged everything."

"It was arranged long ago—I couldn't put all my bets on just one person, especially a notorious playboy, the real scum of the Grindelwald family." Rowende sneered, "Even worse than Peverell."

Martin sighed again, then smiled, "That's obviously not a high evaluation."

"Because that scum is only closer to the throne of power because of the proximity in bloodline. I almost delight in seeing Peverell effortlessly crushing that bastard's daydream."



"But, you're still collaborating with him now." Martin said sharply, "Moreover, you got yourself entangled with Peverell to the core."

"It has ended." Rowenden frowned, slowly revealing a tired expression on his face. "No, Martin, Peverell expelled me in the name of Grindelwald. This is the punishment he gives, the price he demands, for the crime of 'betrayal'... Although, I insist that only the blood of nobility can truly appreciate a wizard's faith, he does respect such honor. So, I am not worried about my future whereabouts — provoking Peverell's wrath is now Andriel's issue."

Rowenden's eyes showed a seemingly genuine sense of schadenfreude... Martin couldn't help but feel a little confused, "In fact, Rowenden, I still don't understand..."

"What?"

"You hate Peverell, of course, there's no doubt about that. He changed everything and destroyed your original life." Watching Rowenden nod in agreement, Martin continued, "However, compared to hate, you're obviously more afraid of him... You fear him more."

As the word "fear" was uttered, Martin saw Rowenden's body shudder, and his pale face turned an unusual shade of pink. "You say... I'm afraid of him?"

Martin nodded.

"Would the descendants of the Grindelwald family be scared? You know, we — this name only makes others scared! How could I fear Peverell!"

"Now, obviously you do." Martin's voice was gentle but firm. "Tell me why, Rowenden. Why are you afraid of Harry Peverell? Admittedly, he's a very talented wizard, proficient in magic and potions, and skilled in business. However, everyone who knows Peverell — I mean, those who have crossed paths with him due to business matters — generally think of him as a mild-mannered person. The workers of Grindelwald Industries also mostly like this so-called 'unassuming nobleman' employer. Both the public and close friends see him as intelligent, calm, gentle, patient, and affectionate. Some deem him cunning and experienced in business, but no one sees him as dangerous. Yet, you are afraid of him, and today's encounter has had such a massive impact on you..."

Rowenden bowed his head in resignation. "You are a perceptive fellow, Martin Devilmour." Pausing for a moment, he lifted his gaze, "It's just that you don't know why I'm afraid of him, and even I don't fully understand it myself. All I know is that staring into his eyes is terrifying, and when he looks away, it feels like escaping death."

***

Rowenden Green didn't end up getting drunk; he left the bar at midnight.

Perhaps this was due to the lingering tension in addition to excitement, and the conversation with Martin Devilmour was another significant factor.

"You respect him... Why are you afraid of Peverell?"

Rowenden sneered, the corner of his mouth curling up sarcastically.

Martin Devilmour, yet another person with a similar interest in Peverell.

An outstanding wizard, intelligent, calm, patient, and enduring. In most cases, his demeanor is gentle, dealing with people kindly. Proficient in magic and potions, adept in business, cunning and smooth in the business world, seasoned and experienced. A miracle boy who single-handedly pulled the Grindelwald family back from the brink of collapse, an excellent successor cultivated and trained by old Dibells — Martin Devilmour's evaluation, and of course, the general understanding of Peverell by others.

"No one considers him dangerous."

But just like he could never understand, because he could never experience what he experienced: how terrifying a figure Harry Peverell was, that only those who challenged his bottom line and directly endured his wrath could truly feel it.

Some instincts must be believed, especially those that come from dangerous signals. Quick to discern such signals, Grindelwald has had a more profound reinforcement of this ability ever since fifty years ago, when that one Dark Lord chose to send two opposing factions to Numengard instead of killing their entire family outright, all for the sake of "respecting familial bonds."

Peverell was dangerous.

He had never seen any wizard with such a powerful deterrent — and he had never met or heard of any thirty-year-old young wizard as powerful as Harry Peverell.

During his time as a potion-making apprentice, he had witnessed Peverell's wandless magic and also noticed that Peverell often cast spells without the aid of a voice in many aspects. Peverell seemed accustomed to casting magic without a medium, not just when brewing potions. This required immense magical power and astonishing magical control, something that only the most accomplished wizards could achieve.

All he had to do was release a tiny bit of this power, without uttering many words or doing much, and the pressure on himself would be immeasurable.

If he wanted to, he could easily read and control his thoughts and actions.

He just never had done so — and Rowenden now had no doubt about this: after today's office meeting, he finally understood what he had deliberately ignored for so long.

Some people could not be provoked, no matter how gentle and harmless they appeared. Peverell never liked or appreciated himself and has made it clear that under his management, "incompetency and discord will not advance." Cutting off not only his own, but also other family members' delusions of continuing to idle through life. The business-savvy Peverell was experienced in dealing with outsiders and rarely displayed resoluteness within his domain. He treated the elders of the family business quite respectfully, providing ample regard and compassion — all these aspects made his management smooth and gave the impression of a young man's bashfulness handling significant affairs. This deceived people into thinking he was young and easily bullied. Believing that his abilities and flexibility were enough to support his negative emotions and bold words, he persistently ignored the potential danger warnings and stubbornly trusted in his erroneous judgment...finally leading to a point of no return.

He thought of those eyes, knowing they should be emerald green, occasionally flashing gently like a serene lake nestled in a forest. But when those eyes gathered stormy clouds and the tranquil lake turned into a raging, boundless ocean...Rowenden couldn't help but shudder.

Expulsion wasn't a display of a lack of anger or retribution, but rather a high-level manifestation of magnanimity. From another perspective, it was essentially the contempt for insignificance. In the end, Peverell still warned him not to try playing with the thunderbolt he had just put down in his hands.

He was a Grindelwald... suddenly realizing this, Rowenden felt a chill down his spine.

—He had made the most erroneous decision in his life.

summary.en: The text describes how Peverell's power and dangerous nature are only experienced by those who challenge him directly. Despite his commercial success and perceived mild-mannered demeanor, he possesses immense magical control and can easily read and manipulate thoughts. Martin realizes that Groin's fear towards Peverell is justified, and that ignoring dangerous signals can have dire consequences. The text ends with Martin realizing he made the most erroneous decision of his life by underestimating Peverell's power.

sub_chapters.name: 申明：我不懂商业，也不会阴谋
sub_chapters.contents:
莱因哈特·冯·葛雷特巴赫。





佩弗利尔静静看着这个又一次不请自来，此刻正悠闲自得地坐在自己办公室沙发上的男人。





阳光照上了他的侧脸，佩弗利尔不得不承认，即使以最苛刻的审美眼光也必须承认，这个金发蓝眸的年轻男人漂亮得耀眼。





而且，具有传统贵族式的俊美和优雅。





想到这一点，佩弗利尔忍不住对办公室里那些色调明快的柚木家具多看了几眼。这不是出于他的设计或喜好，只是在选择这一间作为自己办公室的时候，不可否认，“明亮干净、带一点现代和新潮”这一条对自己具有确实的吸引力。而且，通常人们更容易接受在这样的办公室里进行正式或非正式的商务洽谈，即使巫师会认为这种环境“过于麻瓜”，但商务人士更倾向于这种显示出主场地位但不失双方平等的氛围。自己也很满意这样的情况。不过，每当莱因哈特·冯·葛雷特巴赫出现在这个房间，都会让自己产生强烈的违和感，并且有一种立即挥动魔杖，将这里环境改造成那种大贵族的双层式家庭藏书馆格局布置的冲动。





他需要深色的硬木家具，黑色中微微泛一点红、感觉沉重而豪华的那种；需要洛可可风格的金银器镶宝石装饰品、精美的希腊彩陶和中国瓷器，而不是一个简单的地球仪。房间里唯一勉强配得上他的大约只有一副玉石雕的象棋，不过跟此刻拈着棋子的手指相比，玉石原料依然不够莹润和白皙……





“我可以认为，今天我的手部护理取得了巨大的成功吗，哈利？”





他猛然惊醒过来。“哦，不。”他说，“不，我只是走神了。不过，你来这里的目的是向我炫耀刚刚护理过的双手？”





“显然不。”那一副见了鬼的表情取乐了金发蓝眸的青年，他笑起来。“我是过来问后续的。关于背叛者的处置，还有给对手的回击。”





“罗文德·格里恩是驱逐。”见莱因哈特抬一抬下巴表示“继续”，哈利接着说道，“巴顿卸任配方处的主管，转调到实验一处作普通的实验员。”





等了一会儿，发觉哈利没有继续下文的意思，莱因哈特蓝眸里露出不可思议：“这就……完了？”





“这就是全部。如果，还要加上现在我自己掌控全部配方的话。”





补充说明后，哈利不意外地看到青年俊美的面孔开始不美好地扭曲。“好吧……好吧，我认为我并不是你所痛恨的那一类记者，而且我也不是在出席格林德沃的发布会。哈利·格林德沃·佩弗利尔，即使我们不是可以分享秘密无话不谈的朋友，我以为我们至少是利益一致的合伙人。”





哈利投降似的举起了双手：“别生气，莱因哈特，我们当然是朋友。”他加重了“当然”这个词的读音。“只是，在处置了内部的背叛问题后，你总得给我一点时间恢复——我的情绪并不像能够看到的那样平静，你知道。”





“我知道你痛恨它，‘背叛’。无论行动者是多么不起眼，或者多不受你重视，只要他这样做了，就足够最大程度地触犯你。”莱因哈特表情变得温和起来，“不过，我的朋友，你接下来的动作很重要，因为我不想蒙斯塔顿因为安得列或者说格里恩获利，哪怕那只是暂时的。”





视线接触到青年关切的双眼，哈利微笑了。他从办公桌后起身来到莱因哈特身边坐下，“我的朋友，”他说，“我知道作为一个真正的银行家，葛雷特巴赫和蒙斯塔顿一直维持着良好的合作关系，就像和格林德沃一样。这是最正常合理的，而且明智，我完全可以理解这样的情况。所以，莱因哈特你不需要向我表示什么……如果阿拉冈先生确实已经给他们足够数目的贷款的话。”





莱因哈特显出惊讶的表情，但随即也微笑了。他低下头看着自己的双手，“很抱歉，我应该在他们提出这样大额贷款的时候就告诉你的。”





“那样做是违反银行保密法的——巫师界虽然没有‘泄露商业机密’这样明确的罪名，但商人们依然看重信誉，尤其是葛雷特巴赫这样少数能够同古灵阁分庭抗礼的实力雄厚的大银行。你不能为我犯错，那也是我绝对不希望发生的事情。”看到青年脸上笑容明媚，哈利心情也愉快起来，“而且，如果蒙斯塔顿没有获得贷款，我反而要担心接下来的行动计划能否确实施行并起到我希望的效果了。”





莱因哈特又一次惊讶了，但没有说话，只是静静看着他。





“就在你幻影移形过来前一分钟，戴维·克林斯刚刚带着我的指示出去。我猜想，现在这个时候工场里应该已经换过新的魔药配方，所有生产中的普林特合剂都调整过白蕨根和鲑鱼肠粉的比例了。”





“白蕨根和鲑鱼肠……我可以知道那将有怎样特殊的效果吗？”





哈利微笑点头：“当然可以。变化后的比例有助于增加普林特合剂药性的稳定，使用了新配方的药剂将可以被装在普通的玻璃容器里，而且不必再担心在空气中的挥发问题。”





莱因哈特张大了嘴，半天才大声笑起来：“哦，天哪……梅林，你居然真的试验出来了，哈利！你可以得到药师协会的最高奖——我是说，如果你乐意的话，拜特雅妮夫人一定会非常高兴终于她可以授予你应得的荣誉。”顿了一顿，他又摇一摇头，笑道，“增加了普林特合剂的稳定性，也就是说，从此它们不需要被装在经过特殊加工的试剂瓶里，而你也不需要再专门定制这些昂贵的容器了？解决了稳定性和挥发问题，不再需要为药品的特殊容器付款，普林特的价格当然就能大幅度地降下来，而且，完全可以扩大生产制造的规模！”





哈利快乐地微笑点头：“是，你说的完全没有错。”





“那么这就是你的主意，哈利？”莱因哈特蓝色的眼睛里同样闪出快乐的光芒，并带了一些恶作剧成功的得意，“我想，格里恩和蒙斯塔顿都不知道，人们购买普林特药剂的三分之一的金额，是支出在它的容器上的？”





“药师协会对普林特合剂作出的综合评估中认为，从药用、药效和生产制作成本来看，‘老格林’的利润率远低于魔药市场默认的平均值。我们的优势仅仅在于配方的专利。”交叉起手指将它们撑住自己的下巴，哈利很“诚恳”地说道。“我以为，‘平价’是我接掌格林德沃后一贯的坚持。”





“在任何人眼里都是如此。而这就是你能够迅速占领市场，别人不能与你竞争的根本原因。”莱因哈特一针见血地评价道。“问题是，你总有自己的方式消减一切原料和生产成本，并且大量压缩企业的运营成本。可蒙斯塔顿他们通常不能。所以现在，他们要为昂贵的试剂瓶付账，要熟悉复杂的生产制作环节，要把最终成品的价格控制在‘老格林’目前的定价之下，最后，还要预备和你的改良药剂竞争——考虑到他们已经在罗文德·格里恩和安得列身上投下的资本……哈利，你真的只是个具有生意头脑的魔药大师吗？”





哈利笑着点点头：“我是个生意人，莱因哈特。”





“显然是。我很高兴自己从来就没有怀疑过这一点。”水蓝色眼睛闪出明亮的光彩，莱因哈特随即换了一个更舒服的坐姿——他靠住了哈利，把身体的一半重量分担到好友那里去。“阿拉冈会很生气的……不过相对的，我的投资眼光得到又一次肯定，你知道这对我有多重要。”





哈利微微笑起来。他纵容着美貌的青年表现出平日罕见的得意和慵懒。“问题是，莱因哈特，你没有多少时间清点战利品。我不得不提醒你，距离你到外交事务司上任只有一个月，而且就我所知，你上任后不出三个月就会被派往英国。”





话音未落，莱因哈特已经条件反射地抱怨起来：“那是因为那群老顽固需要一个在财政金融方面有着清醒头脑和判断力，但同时政治力量又相对欠缺的替死鬼去给他们做外交上的挡箭牌。”他的语气混合着轻蔑和些微的自负，“而且，阿拉冈也认为，葛雷特巴赫家族的影响力应该实际地扩展到魔法部——他认为直接出任魔法部官员将是一个良好的宣告，宣告银行家决意不仅用他们的金钱铺路，他们同时拥有自己来打开那些门窗的权利……这真是蠢透了。”





“你不该这么评价你的父亲，莱因哈特。”哈利温和地说道，“毕竟，他是你们家族现任的领导者，而且，你也接受他的这些决定。”





“哈利……我并不是真的在抱怨什么！”金发蓝眸的美貌青年无奈似的轻声叫起来。





“你只是需要向我表明，你不喜欢他们这些违反葛雷特巴赫守则的做法。”哈利微笑着，伸手环住青年肩膀，“我接受你在这里吐的苦水。毕竟，保持中立、追求和享有经济上的绝对权利、拒绝来自纯粹政治的风险和意外，我向来最欣赏银行家的葛雷特巴赫这些地方。你坚持它，而我自然全力支持。”





莱因哈特露出笑容：“听你这样说我舒服不少。只是，有些人不能理解这些的价值，阿拉冈他们，甚至开始忘记所谓传统和守则的意义。他们……阿拉冈认为，一切都已经过去了，那个人被打败、消失了整整十年。他不觉得，继续保持中立，不选择、不干政的态度是必要的。”





在听到“那个人”几个字的时候，哈利脸上的微笑不知不觉地消失了。他几乎是用力地吸了一口气，然后才用平静的声音回答：“危险永远存在——选择的本身就是风险。我记得葛雷特巴赫守则的一开篇就是这个。”





“我们的想法果然是一致的。”金发蓝眸的青年点头，“我并不认为危险真的过去——毕竟，十年前他仅仅是‘消失’，并没有说‘杀死’。事实上，人们根本不能确认什么，就连那场胜利都像是一场最奇异的梦境——在最糟糕最危急的关头，时间突然停摆了；所有人以为是爆炸前最后一秒，可是，倒计时停止了。而人们本身不知道，或者说从来没有人知道，为什么计时器停止了工作。虽然所有人都把原因集中到了那看起来唯一可能的一个……但是，哈利·波特真的是巫师世界的救世主？一个无知的婴儿真的击败了黑魔头？我不能相信。我更倾向于，波特的父母为了保护儿子，动用了一个特别的、强大的、人所罕知的魔法，使得他幸存了下来。”





翠绿色的眸子闪动出一丝奇异的光芒，黑发的巫师脸上的表情有一刻的难以言喻，然而他金发的朋友却兀自沉浸在自己的推想中错过了捕捉。因此，当莱因哈特抬头时，只看见哈利·佩弗利尔沉着而庄重地颔首：“莱因哈特，我认为你的推测是正确的，唯一正确的方向。有很多迹象表明，现在不是一个好时机宣布立场。而且我听说了……有些人，以及有些不太寻常的活动。”





“食死徒。”青年的美貌中突然透出剑一般的冷冽和锋利，他冷冷地说道。“就在万圣节之后，他们开始高调地恢复活动，在各种可能的场合公开行踪，感觉像是在向所有人宣布——已经十年了，巫师社会应该对他们放心，把他们重新接纳进自己的社交圈子了。而英国的前食死徒们，据我得到的消息，由于他们大都保有了曾经的一切，势力恢复得尤其迅速。我猜想这就是我愿意去英国的原因：鉴于某些人所共知的事实，那里无疑是一切有效信息的来源地和异常变动的前沿。而我必须收集和把握它们，并为葛雷特巴赫决定正确的道路。”





“莱因哈特，你永远有着超越常人的锐利和敏感。”哈利微微笑起来，“我得说，在某种意义上，阿拉冈先生将你派到魔法部而不是直接把家族产业移交给你，这是一个非常符合葛雷特巴赫利益的决定。”





金发青年顿时现出具有强大感染力的苦恼表情，只是，目前屋里唯一的一个人并非他仅凭情绪就可以感染的对象。“你得接受这个，莱因哈特。事实上你的理智已经接受了，只是你的感情不愿意这么快就妥协，所以一个多月来你不断地在我这里重复同样说法。而现在，是时候彻底地说服自己了——莱因哈特，你会高高兴兴地去魔法部，然后高高兴兴地去英国。因为，你内心愿意做这个。又因为，事实上，我会和你一起去——去英国。”





哈利·佩弗利尔一字一句说得很平稳，也很冷静。但听到最后一句，莱因哈特终于无法保持镇定，他跳了起来。“什么？！”他嚷道，“你说什么，哈利！我似乎听见你说会和我一起去伦敦！”





“是的，我当然和你一起去。不然，你以为三个月前我向你贷款买下的是哪里的地皮？”板着脸，哈利语声里却透露出微微的笑意，“我早就跟你说过格林—伍德兄弟公司要扩大规模的事情，我在约克郡和康郡看中了新工场的位置，而且，对角巷里也买下了两个不错的铺面。我认为明年三月份是个不错的开业时间，老格林的三百七十周年店庆和老伍德的一百一十一周年。”





“哦，哦——天哪！”莱因哈特一时只能发出这两个词。





哈利上前一步，搂住了他：“你以为我是在跟你开玩笑？放你一个人到人生地不熟的英国魔法部去单打独斗？别傻了，莱因哈特！在你七年来始终坚定不移站在我一边、竭尽全力支持我的事实下，我会允许我最大的支持者陷入他的危机而没有任何作为？”





莱因哈特大笑起来，蓝色的眸子升起些雾气，但随即迸出异常明亮的光彩。他用力地和黑发青年拥抱：“哦，我的朋友，我的哈利——你不知道这些话对我有多大意义！我是说，当我知道你会和我一起……天哪，梅林，我几乎恨不得明天就去魔法部报到！”





“我希望你不是认真的。”哈利半真半假地笑着回答道，“因为我需要你整合手上的资源，当蒙斯塔顿在普林特合剂上迎来史上最大的失败的时候，有充足的资金和人力准备，好接手他让出的地盘——我假设你已经做了一大半？”





莱因哈特大笑着，伸手拍打朋友的肩膀：“如果所有的合作者都像你一样，那就太愉快了。”





“如果都像我一样，就太可怕——太诡异了。”哈利微笑一下，然后转回自己办公桌后的高背椅。坐下，双手十指交叉，“我保证你不会喜欢。”





金发巫师再一次爆发出一阵爽朗的大笑：“哦，是的，当然，有你哈利·佩弗利尔一个就足够了。”说着，从门口衣帽架上拿下精致的丝绸披风，回过头，“那么，这个周末，晚六点，我会准时到格朗斯顿大街你的家里蹭饭。到时候见，哈利。”





“到时候见，莱因哈特。我会让路易准备你喜欢的牛排，所以，记得带上好酒。”





“我已经迫不及待了。”





轻快的笑声中，金发的美貌青年消失在办公室——和来的时候一样，他选择的离去方式仍旧是幻影移形。

translated_name.en: Declaration: I Don't Understand Business, Nor Conspiracies

translation.en:
Rinehart von Gretebach.

Peverell silently watched the man who had come uninvited once again and was now leisurely sitting on the sofa in his office.

Sunlight shone on his face, and Peverell had to admit that he had to acknowledge the dazzling beauty of this blond-haired and blue-eyed young man, even with the strictest aesthetic standards.

Moreover, he had the traditional noble beauty and elegance.

Thinking of this, Peverell couldn't help but take a few more glances at the brightly colored teak furniture in the office. It was not due to his design or preference, but when choosing this room as his office, it was undeniable that the criteria of "bright and clean, with a touch of modernity and trendiness" had an actual appeal to him. Also, people usually found it easier to accept formal or informal business talks in such an office; even if wizards thought the environment was "too Muggle-like", business people preferred an atmosphere that showed the home field advantage but also equality between both parties. Peverell was quite satisfied with this situation. However, whenever Rinehart von Gretebach appeared in this room, it always gave Peverell a strong sense of unease, along with an urge to immediately wave his wand and transform the place into the elaborate layout of a double-layered aristocratic home library.

He needed dark hardwood furniture - the kind that was slightly reddish in its blackness, heavy and luxurious; he needed Rococo-style gold and silver ornaments studded with gemstones, exquisite Greek painted pottery, and Chinese porcelain, rather than a simple globe. The only thing in the room that could barely match him was a jade-carved chess set; but compared to the fingers now holding the chess pieces, the jade material still lacked the luster and whiteness...

"May I assume that my hand care today was a great success, Harry?"

He suddenly awakened from his stupor. "Oh, no," he said, "No, I was just distracted. But is the purpose of your visit to show off your freshly cared-for hands?"

"Obviously not." The sight of the ghostly expression amused the blond blue-eyed youth, who laughed. "I came here to ask about the follow-up. Regarding the handling of the betrayer, and the retaliation against the opponent."

"Rowena Green is expelled." Seeing Rinehart raise his chin to indicate "continue," Harry went on, "Batten steps down as the head of the formula department, and is transferred to the experimental department as a regular experimenter."

After waiting for a while, realizing that Harry did not intend to continue, Rinehart's blue eyes showed disbelief: "That's... it?"

"That's all. If, also considering that I now control all formulas."

After the supplementary explanation, Harry watched the young man's handsome face distort with displeasure, as expected. "Alright... alright, I don't think I'm the type of reporter you hate, nor am I attending Grindelwald's press conference. Harry Grindelwald Peverell, even if we're not friends who can share secrets and confide in each other, I thought we were at least partners with common interests."

Harry raised both hands in surrender: "Don't be angry, Rinehart. We are, of course, friends." He emphasized the word "of course." "It's just that, after dealing with the internal betrayal issue, you have to give me some time to recover - my emotions are not as calm as they appear, you know."

"I know you hate it, 'betrayal.' No matter how insignificant the actor is or how little valued by you, it is enough to offend you in the worst way when they do it," Rinehart's expression softened, "But, my friend, your next move is crucial since I don't want Montage to profit from Andrey or, let's say, Green, even if it's just temporary."

Meeting the young man's concerned gaze, Harry smiled. He got up from behind his desk and sat down beside Rinehart, "My friend," he said, "As a true banker, Gretebach and Montage have always maintained good cooperation, just like with Grindelwald. This is normal, reasonable, and wise. I can fully understand that. So, Rinehart, you don't need to express anything to me... if Mr. Aragon has indeed given them enough loans."

Rinehart's surprise was apparent, but he soon smiled as well. He looked down at his hands, "I'm sorry, I should have told you when they requested such a large loan."

"That would have violated the bank's confidentiality law - although the Wizarding World does not have the clear crime of 'leaking trade secrets,' businessmen still value reputation, especially for powerful banks like Gretebach that can rival Gringotts. You cannot make a mistake for my sake; that is something I absolutely do not want to happen." Seeing the radiant smile on the young man's face, Harry's mood brightened as well, "Moreover, if Montage hadn't received the loan, I would have been more worried about whether the subsequent action plan could indeed be implemented and have the desired effect."

Rinehart was surprised again but remained silent, only watching Harry quietly.

"Just a minute before you apparated here, David Kline had just left with my instructions. I guess that at this very moment, the new potion formula should have been changed in the factory, and all the Amortentia in production have been adjusted with the proportions of White Fern Root and Salmon Gut Powder."

"White Fern Root and Salmon... may I know what special effect that will have?"

Harry nodded with a smile: "Of course. The adjusted ratio helps to increase the stability of Amortentia's efficacy. Medicines made with the new formula can be stored in ordinary glass containers, and there is no need to worry about the volatility problem in the air anymore."

Rinehart opened his mouth wide and burst into laughter after a while, "Oh, my God! Merlin! You've actually made it work, Harry! You could get the highest award from the pharmacists' association - I mean, if you want to, Lady Brittany would be delighted to finally grant you the honor you deserve." He paused and shook his head with a smile, "You've improved the stability of the Printheus potion, which means they don't need to be stored in specially processed vials and you don't need custom expensive containers anymore? With the stability and evaporation issues resolved, you won't need to pay for the special containers, which means the price of Printheus can drop significantly, and production can be expanded!"

Harry smiled happily and nodded, "Yes, you're absolutely right."
